title: Data Analyst
job_description: DescriptionThis position is incentive eligible.This is a hybrid position. Candidates must live near a Galen campus in Florida, Texas, Kentucky, Tennessee, Nevada, Kansas, North Carolina, South Carolina, Ohio, Utah, Colorado or Virginia.IntroductionAre you passionate about delivering superior work outcomes? At Galen College of Nursing, we are committed to a single purpose: offering excellence in nursing education. Our staff and administration live out our vision! We change the life of one to care for the lives of many. Jump-start your career as a Data Analyst today with Galen College of Nursing.BenefitsAt Galen College of Nursing, we want to ensure your needs are met. We offer a comprehensive package of medical, dental, and vision plans along with unique benefits, including:Comprehensive medical coverage that covers many common services at no cost or for a low copay. Plans include prescription drug and behavioral health coverage as well as free telemedicine services and free AirMed medical transportation. Additional options for dental and vision benefits, life and disability coverage, flexible spending accounts, supplemental health protection plans (accident, critical illness, hospital indemnity), auto and home insurance, identity theft protection, legal counseling, long-term care coverage, moving assistance, pet insurance and more. Free counseling services and resources for emotional, physical and financial wellbeing 401(k) Plan with a 100% match on 3% to 9% of pay (based on years of service) Employee Stock Purchase Plan with 10% off HCA Healthcare stock Family support through fertility and family building benefits with Progyny and adoption assistance. Referral services for child, elder and pet care, home and auto repair, event planning and more Consumer discounts through Abenity and Consumer Discounts Retirement readiness, rollover assistance services and preferred banking partnerships Education assistance (tuition, student loan, certification support, dependent scholarships) Colleague recognition program Time Away From Work Program (paid time off, paid family leave, long- and short-term disability coverage and leaves of absence)Employee Health Assistance Fund that offers free employee-only coverage to full-time and part-time colleagues based on income. Learn More About Employee BenefitsNote: Eligibility for benefits may vary by location.The Data Analyst is responsible for performing statistical analyses, developing reports, and overseeing data collection and research, as it relates to courses, campus operations, faculty evaluations, student services, surveys, and other aspects of the student and faculty experience, as needed to support Galen 's institutional effectiveness and research activities.Position ResponsibilitiesPerform statistical analyses for the College on data related to courses, campus operations, faculty evaluations, student services, surveys, and other aspects of the student and faculty experience as needed. Create and compile reports based on survey results and program outcome data. Assist with the selection and/or development of appropriate instruments for the assessment of program and student learning outcomes. Gather, validate, and analyze data to help College leaders make informed decisions. Serve as a resource for academic units in developing, measuring, and analyzing learning outcomes. Serve as a resource for administrative units in developing, measuring, and analyzing performance outcomes. Create and implement effective ways to process data. Build advanced statistical models for predicting academically-related outcomes e.g., predicting first-time pass rates for students taking the National Council Licensure Examination (NCLEX).Perform statistical analyses and research. Communicate with College leaders and other individuals to gather requirements to perform analysesPrepare reports that show trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data. Work with the Data Engineers team to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies. Prepare final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to make important decisions based on various facts and trends. Collecting and analyzing data for publishing. Other duties as needed to support the institutional effectiveness activities of the College. Position RequirementsEducation: A graduate degree in Psychology, Statistics, or a related field. Doctorate degree preferred.Experience: Minimum of three (3) to five (5) years of research experience. Experience with survey research is a plus. Experience in developing and reviewing IRB applications is a plus.Special Qualifications: Ability to conduct analyses using inferential statistics, as well as more advanced techniques e.g., Random Forest, Cluster Analysis. Proficiency using Microsoft Excel (including pivot tables) and the rest of the Microsoft Office suite. Experience with SPSS, SAS, or Stata. Proficiency programming in R for statistical calculations. Great attention to detail.Excellent oral and written communication skills. Must be able to communicate the results of statistical analyses to audiences in written and graphical form. The ability to learn quickly and shift priorities as needed in a fast-paced environment.Physical/Mental Demands & Work Environment: The ability to sit at a desk for up to eight (8) hours per day.Degree of Supervision: MinimalBe a part of an organization that invests in you. We are actively reviewing applications for our Data Analyst opening. Highly qualified candidates will be promptly contacted for interviews. Submit your application and help us raise the bar in nursing education!We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Sr. Data Analyst
job_description: The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for gathering and analyzing primarily healthcare data from multiple sources to identify trends and troubleshoot data inconsistencies. The individual(s) in this role must be analytical and resourceful and have excellent communication skills. The Senior Data Analyst will provide oversight to less senior analyst roles. They will be responsible for designing data pipelines and infrastructure, developing reports and dashboards, interpreting data, and communicating to technical and non-technical audiences. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements while providing status reports and updates to HRSA grant participating health centers (PHC) or OSIS Members.Essential Job FunctionsGather and integrate data from disparate sources, interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional business requirementsGather reporting requirements and design, develop, and maintain ongoing reports as requested for the HRSA HCCN Grant or other assignments.Sustain and expand a growing data warehouse, including monitoring hardware resources, adding new service lines of data, and ensuring data pipelines are efficiently and successfully completed within the required timeframe.Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements, such as automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.Troubleshoot data inconsistencies found in reports utilizing an understanding of multiple database structures and workflow best practices, including but not limited to the NextGen EHR system. Maintain knowledge related to pertinent content areas, new developments and industry trends related to regulatory reporting programs including but not limited to: UDS, CMS and state MU/PI reporting, payment reform, relevant specialty reporting, as well as accountable care or other value-based performance metrics. Work with grant PHCs and other analytic teams across the organization to perform research and analysis to outline specific data needs as part of the design process.Utilize reporting tools to obtain, gather and compile at individual PHC and whole population levels.Design, develop, and maintain complex dashboards utilizing Microsoft Power BI for use by both internal and external users.Builds and maintains external and internal relationships to drive mutually beneficial solutions and drive positive Member and Client experiences.Serve as a mentor to coach and provide guidance to other less senior clinical quality data analyst roles. Act as a project lead for specified project-based deliverables, which may involve cross-team collaboration and/or activities.Communicate clearly and effectively with stakeholders about data changes or requirements.Training end users on new reports and dashboards, with the ability to translate data into non-technical, lay terms.Be a resource and advocate for data by teaching and empowering others to use data.Required Education And ExperienceBachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Healthcare Administration, or related field or 4+ years of related field experience2+ yearsâ€™ experience in a HealthCare settingHighly proficient with database programming languages such as SQLNextGen electronic health record software experienceAdvanced knowledge of and experience with reporting packages/data visualization tools.Preferred ExperienceExperience with healthcare regulatory reporting, such as UDS or Meaningful Use/Promoting Interoperability. Basic understanding of clinical operations, medical terminologyPrevious FQHC or non-profit experience.Telecommuting And Technical RequirementsThis position can telecommute on an as-needed basis.Must Have Cable or Fiber Internet Service  Download speed of 20Mbps or higher  Upload speed of 5Mbps or higher

title: Data Analyst and Systems Manager
job_description: Job SummaryThe purpose of the Data Analyst and Systems Manager position is to manage and analyze data, develop insights and data visualizations, and maintain the systems that support our worker and fleet safety initiatives. Reporting to and working closely with the Director of Safety Central Services, the Data Analyst and Systems Manager will play a crucial role in leveraging data to enhance worker safety and fleet safety operations. The role must understand relational databases and understand how to set them up at every stage, and then distill that data and information in the way the business needs to consume it. As a member of our corporate safety team, the Data Analyst and Systems Manager will help support national operations for Darling Ingredients.Essential Duties/ResponsibilitiesNothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.Gathers, homogenizes, and standardizes data from a variety of sources both digital and non-digital, and set up a relational database. Serves as safety department lead on data analysis, including analyzing and interpreting data from various sources to identify trends, patterns and insights relevant to worker and fleet safety.Create and maintain dashboards, scorecards, and other data visualizations to track safety performance and KPIs, with the appropriate tools (Tableau, PowerBI, etc.).Collaborate with cross-functional teams to partner and integrate pre-existing business data into new systems. Oversee the administration and maintenance of the database as well as existing and new safety-related systems (Compliance tracker, Ideagen, etc.).Collaborate with IT, the Office of Project Management, and other SMEs to implement systems and ensure back-end data integrations align with objectives. Manage data integrations between HRIS and other systems and platforms to ensure a seamless and standardized flow of data. Minimum QualificationsBA in data science, computer science, statistics, or a related field. Extensive certifications will be considered. Proven experience in data analysis, data management, data visualization, and system administration, especially with setting up a relational database from start to finish. High level of proficiency with SQL and excel. Strong knowledge of database management systems. Strong interpersonal skills: must work well in teams and be able to develop relationships with various levels of management.Willingness to learn Safety. Self-motivated; self-starter.Highly organized; superior time management skills.Preferred QualificationsMaster's Degree in computer science, statistics, or related field preferred.At least 5 years' experience data analytics and management. Experience with Python, or R, and other reporting tools Tableau, Alterix, Data Robot, Power BI, etc. Familiarity with and leveraging technology to support organizational initiatives.Familiarity with developing lagging and leading indicator trending, including predictive analytics. Physical DemandsFrequently required to walk, stand, sit, climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crawl and crouch.Occasionally required to lift up to 50lbs.Regularly required to reach with hands and arms.Work EnvironmentJob duties will be carried out in multiple environments including office, plant, customer location, and transportation vehicles.Darling Ingredients is an equal opportunity employer and gives consideration to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, age, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, physical or mental disability, military service, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state and local law. Daily responsibilities will involve proficient use of MS SQL, encompassing Transactional SQL, SQL Reporting Services, and SQL Server Integration Services. Additionally, this role will require leading and providing assistance to peers in the analysis efforts within the Software Support team.Unpacking the Be n efits: Competitive individual and group computer science or software engineering, or equivalent work experience  3 to 5 years of cumulative experience in software support, reporting services, and data analysis roles Your Mission in Motio n : Lead long-term data analysis projects  Work across departments to define metrics, identify opportunities, and share strategies for effective use of data  Communicate technical terms and requirements in a manner meaningful to non-technical end users  Develop SQL Server tools to empower other data consumers across the company  Commission and decommission data sets  Assist in the administration of the data warehouse  Take a leadership role in advising and reviewing analysis and reporting work of others  Assist troubleshooting and application support by leveraging knowledge of and experience with company data  Assist with customer integrations for B2B data exchange Paving your way to your success: Working technical knowledge of programming languages  Experience working in integrated development environments, including Microsoft Visual Studio  Experience with Microsoft Windows operating systems  Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, including specifically SSRS, SSMS, and SSIS  Ability to write and troubleshoot Transact SQL queries  Ability to research and analyze data  Demonstrated analytical prowess, self-motivation, and adaptability  Exceptional communication skills and task management under pressure  Proficient in both independent work and collaborative teamwork, with a knack for research If you are excited to be part of our team and grow with our OnTrac family , we title: Business Intelligence Data Reporting Analyst, GPS
job_description: Business Intelligence Data Reporting AnalystGovernment and public services (GPS) reporting and data dashboarding role required to support recurring FAR/DFAR related regulatory reports to SBA and other government entities and internal stakeholders.Recruiting for this role ends on April 13thWork You'll DoThis position will assist with multiple data, reporting and system requirements managed by the Business Intelligence Regulatory Reporting team within GPS Contracts (GPSC). This role requires a detail-oriented individual who can perform due diligence reviews of multiple data sets within internal and 3 rd party systems, process this data and provide meaningful solutions to management.The individual will process Individual Subcontract Reports (ISRs) and Summary Subcontract Reports (SSRs) to ensure US Federal Government reporting requirements are met. The candidate will use analytical and forensic skills to review reports throughout the lifecycle of a contract and will participate in coordinated actions required in response to the report submissions. This will require an understanding of the nature of each contract record type requested for reporting and how records are entered in the eSRS system or via manual submission (SF-294).This role will also be responsible for monitoring report statuses and alerts within eSRS and will assist in resubmitting and closing out open actions as required.This position will also assist with additional reporting and dashboarding requirements (using business intelligence reporting tools) and system onboarding tasks in addition to other data-related requirements.The TeamThe Business Intelligence Regulatory Reporting team resides within GPS Contracts (GPSC) and ensures all data and dashboard reporting requirements are executed successfully for both internal and external stakeholders. The team is centered on supporting US federal government, US state/local government, and higher education data, systems and regulatory obligations.QualificationsRequired:Minimum years of experience: 1 yearBachelor's degreeExperience with Government contracting agreement structures and filing requirementsExperience with BI tools: Tableau, PowerBI, and/or CognosMust be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the futurePreferredComfortable using SharePoint as a content owner/providerFamiliarity with FAR, DFAR, and other supplements; especially FAR 52.219-9, 52.232-40Masters degree in public policy/administration or related fieldAnalytical thinker who completes timely forensic, investigative tasksQuick learner of system interfacesSkilled communicator, especially via email, who can coordinate required actions with internal practitioners and external vendors and write clear instructionsAbility to write process/work instruction documentationAbility to identify, collaborate, and execute on process improvement opportunitiesAbility to oversee a wide portfolio of tasks to include responsiveness to audit inquiriesAttention to data security and handling of potentially sensitive informationInformation for applicants with a need for accommodation: https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/articles/join-deloitte-assistance-for-disabled-applicants.htmlThe wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $60,000.00 - $110,500.00 You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.
Industries: Accounting, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services

title: Data Analyst and Systems Manager
job_description: Job Summary The purpose of the Data Analyst and Systems Manager position is to manage and analyze data, develop insights and data visualizations, and maintain the systems that support our worker and fleet safety initiatives. Reporting to and working closely with the Director of Safety Central Services, the Data Analyst and Systems Manager will play a crucial role in leveraging data to enhance worker safety and fleet safety operations. The role must understand relational databases and understand how to set them up at every stage, and then distill that data and information in the way the business needs to consume it. As a member of our corporate safety team, the Data Analyst and Systems Manager will help support national operations for Darling Ingredients. Essential Duties/Responsibilities Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. Gathers, homogenizes, and standardizes data from a variety of sources both digital and non-digital, and set up a relational database. Serves as safety department lead on data analysis, including analyzing and interpreting data from various sources to identify trends, patterns and insights relevant to worker and fleet safety. Create and maintain dashboards, scorecards, and other data visualizations to track safety performance and KPIs, with the appropriate tools (Tableau, PowerBI, etc.). Collaborate with cross-functional teams to partner and integrate pre-existing business data into new systems. Oversee the administration and maintenance of the database as well as existing and new safety-related systems (Compliance tracker, Ideagen, etc.). Collaborate with IT, the Office of Project Management, and other SMEs to implement systems and ensure back-end data integrations align with objectives. Manage data integrations between HRIS and other systems and platforms to ensure a seamless and standardized flow of data. Minimum Qualifications BA in data science, computer science, statistics, or a related field. Extensive certifications will be considered. Proven experience in data analysis, data management, data visualization, and system administration, especially with setting up a relational database from start to finish. High level of proficiency with SQL and excel. Strong knowledge of database management systems. Strong interpersonal skills: must work well in teams and be able to develop relationships with various levels of management. Willingness to learn Safety. Self-motivated; self-starter. Highly organized; superior time management skills. Preferred Qualifications Master's Degree in computer science, statistics, or related field preferred. At least 5 years' experience data analytics and management. Experience with Python, or R, and other reporting tools Tableau, Alterix, Data Robot, Power BI, etc. Familiarity with and leveraging technology to support organizational initiatives. Familiarity with developing lagging and leading indicator trending, including predictive analytics. Physical Demands Frequently required to walk, stand, sit, climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crawl and crouch. Occasionally required to lift up to 50lbs. Regularly required to reach with hands and arms. Work Environment Job duties will be carried out in multiple environments including office, plant, customer location, and transportation vehicles. Darling Ingredients is an equal opportunity employer and gives consideration to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, age, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, physical or mental disability, military service, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state and local law. Know Your Rights: If you would like more information, please click on the link and paste into your browser: Job Posted by ApplicantPro

title: Data Analyst I RN Required
job_description: Job DescriptionThe Data Analyst compiles and coordinates flow of quality improvement information within the medical staff departments. Performs analysis on data. Maintains Automated Quality System by compiling, writing, analyzing and distributing data. Manages CMS/JCAHO publicly reported data extraction and reporting.Quality ManagementReviews charts concurrently and retrospectively for quality compliance by comparing information to pre-determined indicators. Enter results of review into appropriate computer database. Coordinates Data for CMS, TJC, analyzes data, reports information and recommends action.  Coordinates high profile data and reports for the organization.  Coordinates information and provides data from chart to hospital attorney as needed, maintaining confidentiality.  Analyzes aggregate data results and identifies areas in which to improve patient care. Leading/Planning/Organizing Annually develops objective criteria that reflect current knowledge and clinical experience meeting TJC requirements for the Medical Staff.  Writes for RFP's, awards and various quality presentations. Staff Development Identifies unusual events and forwards cases to Peer Review or Risk Management as appropriate (if not previously identified).  Provides training to new employees in areas of quality/peer review.  Acts as a resource for these definitions for Medical Center. Information Management Monitors focuses for accuracy  Enters information for Special Studies. Prepares reports from study and distributes appropriately.  Prepares graphs using graphics software. Communications Develops and writes reports for Department Chairs, QCC Board and External Agencies as required/requested.  Works to coordinate activities with Peer Review Coordinator and Review Staff. Collaborates regarding indicators/Peer Review issues/MIDAS issues/follow-up.  Reports on aggregate data, chart reviews at various Medical Staff Department meetings. Performs other duties as assignedQualifications MINIMUM  DESIRABLE Education, Credentials, Licenses RN license in state where work is performed with accreditation current  RN license in state where work is performed with BSN, BS or BA Specialized Knowledge Knowledge of disease processes  Good interpersonal Communication Skills  Knowledge of computer programs, MS Office and MIDAS.  Problem solving.  Ability to identify from chart content the pertinent items needed to perform function & to organize the items for presentation.  Knowledge of specialty areas such as OB, PE, PS  Knowledge of quality review concepts & systems, including TJC.  Knowledge and ability in essentials of study reporting, using graphs.  Knowledge of TJC Quality Standards  Knowledge of basic statistics.  CPHQ certification. Kind And Length Of Experience5 years in RN experience in Med/Surg patient care in hospital. 1 year or more experience in quality review.  1 year or more experience reporting of quality review activities. If, for any reason, you are having difficulties applying, please contact our recruitment team at recruiting@stelizabeth.com

title: Senior Customer Experience Data Analyst
job_description: As a Senior Customer Experience Data Analyst, you will help build a deeper understanding of our customer experience. You will be a key member of the Customer Experience global team at Infineon working with our Voice of the Customer programs to seek and unearth action able insights and recommendations to improve customer experiences. Day to day activities include analyzing structured and unstructured customer feedback and transactional data, working with advanced analytics team members to develop data-driven insights, and modeling predictive analytics to inform key process improvements. Does this sound exciting? If so, please apply today!Infineon is the global market leader in automotive and power semiconductors. Ranking within the top 100 companies to work for, by Forbes, Infineon is also known for our focus on digitalization and decarbonization to ensure we are contributing to a sustainable world. Infineon strives to create best-in-class customer experiences with each interaction with our customers and partners.In your new role you will:Translate technical aspects of analysis and metrics into insightsPossess strong data driven storytelling skills as it relates to customer experienceCreate and deliver compelling visualization, write documents to explain analysis and insightsExperience with Advanced SQL, ability to write complex queries from scratch using multiple tables, creating appropriate joins, extracting and manipulating data, formatting fieldsFluency with advanced analytical tools (python, R, SAS) ability to run advanced statistical modeling and testing in one or more languagesExperience working with databases and data mining techniques in business environmentsUnderstanding of data warehousing and data modeling conceptsYou are best equipped for this task if you have: Bachelors degree in engineering, statistics, computer science or similar discipline10+ years experience of working in analytics with customer and or employee experience data5+ years experience with data visualization tools (Tableau or PowerBI) in creating data/reporting for senior level management5+ years experience in B2C and B2B data analysis across multiple personas3+ years experience in predictive analyticsEffective written and verbal communication skillsMasters degree in engineering, statistics, technology management2+ years experience in semiconductor industry

title: Power BI Dashboard and Report Developer / ETL Developer
job_description: Your Journey at Crowe Starts Here:At Crowe, you have the opportunity to deliver innovative solutions to todayâ€™s complex business issues. Croweâ€™s accounting, consulting, and technology personnel are widely recognized for their in-depth expertise and understanding of sophisticated process frameworks and enabling technologies, along with their commitment to delivering measurable results that help clients build business value. Our focus on emerging technology solutions along with our commitment to internal career growth and exceptional client value has resulted in a firm that is routinely recognized as a â€œBest Place to Work.â€ We are 75 years strong and still growing. Come grow with us!Job Description:Crowe is seeking a Power BI Dashboard and Report Developer / ETL Developer to focus on data analysis, interpretation of complex data requests, and data visualization. This role plays a critical part in designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines and delivering impactful analytics solutions to our clients.ResponsibilitiesData Analysis & ReportingInterpret complex data requests and retrieve data from a variety of data sources (Primarily Dataverse). Create visually compelling reports using Power BI. Deliver a high level of accuracy with paginated reports. Continuously deliver and improve prioritized analytics, reporting, and visualization solutions. Data Integration & ManagementParticipate in data governance initiatives including data profiling and quality checks. Communication & CollaborationExhibit strong writing and communication skills for diverse business and technical audiences. Work collaboratively in Agile teams to refine requirements and develop data solutions. Contribute to the establishment and update design patters and standard operating procedures Project ManagementBalance multiple project and client deadlines. Identify project risks, notify leadership, and collaborate to mitigate issues. Work with clients in a professional and collaborative manner. RequirementsMust-Have QualificationsBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Informatics, or other degree with appropriate experience. Two or more years of experience specifically in Power BI development and data analytics. Proficiency in using Power BI with multiple complex data sources include (but not limited to): Dataverse, SQL, SharePoint, Azure data sources, etc. Expertise in Power BI development, including visual reports, dashboards, and data modeling. Experience with paginated reports with supporting practical experience (SSRS experience can be used for this requirement). Nice-to-Have QualificationsExperience with Microsoft Azure, SQL Data Warehouse, and Visual Studio. Familiarity with ETL concepts and SaaS tools or ADF Integration. Soft SkillsExcellent analytical thinking. Strong teamwork, adaptability, and problem-solving skills. Exception communication and desire to mentor others About the Team: Product Engineering professionals at Crowe lead the software development efforts for the firm and build technology solutions in a consistent and reliable way. Product Engineering owns the software development competency for the firm, which is tied to standardized processes, practices, policies and controls for client-facing products and projects. Team members share expertise across various industries, targeting manufacturing and distribution, government, healthcare, financial services, and private equity groups based on demand from other Business Units. You will learn and build on a wide range of technologies in an environment where innovation and new ideas are highly encouraged. Hop on board to join one of the fastest growing technology consulting practices in the industry.Our Benefits:At Crowe, we know that great people are what makes a great firm. We value our people and offer employees a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about what working at Crowe can mean for you!How You Can Grow:We will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. You will have the chance to meet on a consistent basis with your Career Coach that will guide you in your career goals and aspirations. Learn more about where talent can prosper!More about Crowe:Crowe (www.crowe.com) is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. Crowe uses its deep industry expertise to provide audit services to public and private entities while also helping clients reach their goals with tax, advisory, risk and performance services. Crowe is recognized by many organizations as one of the country's best places to work. Crowe serves clients worldwide as an independent member of Crowe Global, one of the largest global accounting networks in the world. The network consists of more than 200 independent accounting and advisory services firms in more than 130 countries around the world.Crowe LLP provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.Crowe LLP does not accept unsolicited candidates, referrals or resumes from any staffing agency, recruiting service, sourcing entity or any other third-party paid service at any time. Any referrals, resumes or candidates submitted to Crowe, or any employee or owner of Crowe without a pre-existing agreement signed by both parties covering the submission will be considered the property of Crowe, and free of charge.
Industries: Accounting, Financial Services, and IT Services and IT Consulting

title: Technical Data Steward (213984-886)
company: Restaurant Supply Chain Solutions, LLC - A Yum! Brands Co-op
job_description: Restaurant Supply Chain Solutions, LLC, a Yum! Brands Co-op, is currently seeking a Technical Data Steward to join the Business Technology team in Louisville, KY.  Position Overview:This position functions as a technical data steward within the organization, managing incoming data feeds and data quality.  Essential Functions* Operational responsibility for monitoring incoming and outgoing data feeds and data quality.* Working with functional business data stewards, research data quality issues to resolution, and work with data engineers to continuously improve data quality processes.* Analyze data, identifying trends to fine-tune business rules for data quality monitoring.* Ad-hoc processing of jobs to load data.* Works with Data Engineer to build/enhance data monitoring solutions.* Follow up with data trading partners to resolve incoming data issues. Research issue and provide guidance to trading partner as to how to correct issues.* Be the subject matter expert for distributor and supplier data that feed RSCS systems. Education, Experience and Skills* Bachelor's degree required in computer science, information technology, or business administration.* Minimum of 3 years of experience as a data analyst.* Strong communication skills. * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. * Prefer supply chain experience.* Prefer experience in an environment that processes data feeds from dozens/hundreds of trading partners. * Technical skills required: MS SQL Server, T-SQL, and SSMS* Prefer experience in SSIS, SSRS, PowerBI, scripting language such as PowerShell, Python, etc., and Data Modeling. * Strong desire to become SME in distributor and supplier data.* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.* Proficient with Microsoft Office Programs (i.e., Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook).
Job function: Analyst, Information Technology, and Supply Chain
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

title: Senior Defined Benefits Data Analyst
job_description: 2088281-2Job DescriptionThe Role The Senior Defined Benefit Data Analyst will support the business by working on highly complex Defined Benefit data consulting projects, demonstrating their analytical strengths and skills. We are looking for someone to join our great team of experts, who enjoy a fast-paced environment, and can provide quality work and an outstanding client/customer experience.The analyst leverages various service category databases, data warehouses, and other technical applications (i.e. Informatica, Snap Logic, SQL, Access, Snowflake, Excel) to identify, analyze and propose solutions to clean the data required to provide accurate administration of Defined Benefits.The ideal candidate likes a challenge and is looking for direct client impacting, rewarding work. The analysis we perform is directly helping our clients and their employees to realize hard earned retirement dreams. No two days will be the same making this a great role for someone who is looking for variety day to day with a direct to client impact.The Team The Fidelity Workplace Consulting Group is composed of over 300 professionals who advise clients on the management of their domestic benefits. We are a fast-growing business within Fidelity, providing a broad range of services that touch on every area of benefits design, strategy, funding, communication, and delivery. While we focus on working with the Fortune 1000, we also work with Fidelity clients of all sizes.Data Consulting engages in data quality improvement efforts that span single and multiple product lines (i.e. Health and Welfare, Defined Benefit, Defined Contribution, Stock Plan Services and HR/Payroll) within the implementation and ongoing servicing client lifecycle.The Expertise and Skills You BringBachelor's degree or equivalent years of experience4+ Years of Defined Benefit/Pension Administration experience2+ years writing SQL preferredExperience using Excel formulas for quick data analysis and data comparisonsAbility to translate technical client specifications into data analysis deliverablesStrong data analysis skillsExperience querying large data sets with optimized SQL codeKnowledge of Fidelityâ€™s backend product tables (DBR1, WIDE, Snowflake, etc.) a plusAbility to prioritize fast paced workExperience in a consulting role a plusETL Experience a plusThe Value You DeliverHigh Quality data analysis with an attention to detail and clear communicationsOwnership of your delivery with minimal directionOn time delivery of time sensitive project workCollaboration with teammates to ensure handoffs are made effectivelyRecommendations of ways to streamline and/or enhance data analysis processesUnit tested deliverablesInterest and curiosity in your work that translates to thoughtful questions and engaging discussions leading to positive client experiencesThe base salary range for this position is $63,000-$100,000 per year.Placement in the range will vary based on job responsibilities and scope, geographic location, candidateâ€™s relevant experience, and other factors.Base salary is only part of the total compensation package. Depending on the position and eligibility requirements, the offer package may also include bonus or other variable compensation.We offer a wide range of benefits to meet your evolving needs and help you live your best life at work and at home. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage and emotional well-being support, market-leading retirement, generous paid time off and parental leave, charitable giving employee match program, and educational assistance including student loan repayment, tuition reimbursement, and learning resources to develop your career. Note, the application window closes when the position is filled or unposted.CertificationsCompany OverviewFidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clientsâ€™ money.Join UsAt Fidelity, youâ€™ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoplesâ€™ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employeesâ€™ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you donâ€™t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelityâ€”we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career youâ€™ve always imagined.Fidelity's working model blends the best of working offsite with maximizing time together in person to meet associate and business needs. Currently, most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of one assigned week per four-week period (beginning in September 2024, the requirement will be two full assigned weeks).At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations@fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.

title: Junior Infrastructure Engineer
job_description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. Additionally, you'll troubleshoot performance issues that require hands-on experience with OS Support (VMware, Windows, Linux), Servers (Blade, rack-mount), storage, and networking. All relevant backgrounds are considered.Junior Server Infrastructure Engineer requires 0-2 years of the followingServer Infrastructure Engineer requires 2-5 years of the followingSenior Server Infrastructure Engineer requires 5+ years of the followingHands-on administration and troubleshooting experience with blade, rack-mount, and virtual server infrastructureExperience with server management products such as Cisco UCS Central, Lenovo xClarity Administrator, or Dell OpenManage EnterprisePractical application of scripting languages such as PowerShell, Go, or PythonServer resource capacity management and system tuningOther Preferred Skills And ExperienceExperience with Cisco's Unified Computing System (B/C Series and Fabric Interconnects), Dell, or Lenovo serversKnowledge of VMware HA, DRS, and server/storage VMotionExperience troubleshooting Server side SAN and network configurationsExperience in replacing CPUs, DIMMs, power supplies, or other server hardwareCertifications in one or more of the following is a plus VCP, CCNA-DC, CCNP-DCOther RequirementsRelocation to Madison, WI (reimbursed)Eligibility to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorshipCOVID-19 vaccinationAs a member of the Hosting team at Epic you'll be responsible for the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of Epic Hosting. title: EHR Analyst Senior/UKHC
job_description: Posting DetailsJob Title EHR Analyst Senior/UKHCRequisition Number RE44878Working Title EHR Analyst Senior - AmbulatoryDepartment Name H3997:EVPHA Information TechnologyWork Location Lexington, KYGrade Level 12Salary Range $62,400-111,634/yearType of Position StaffPosition Time Status  Full-TimeRequired EducationBSClick here for more information about equivalencies: https://hr.uky.edu/employment/working-uk/equivalenciesRequired Related Experience5 yrsRequired License/Registration/CertificationEpic Certification required within 90 days of hirePhysical RequirementsThe essential job functions of this position require you to: communicate and build strategic working relationships with staff and other individuals from diverse backgrounds; abide by University guidelines; maintain confidentiality; prioritize and manage work effectively; work within a fact paced, time sensitive project; positively represent the University; perform work in a sedentary position; report to meetings at different locations both on campus and off campus; travel outside the local area for training; and work successfully with a team and independently.ShiftThe expectation is primarily day shift Monday through Friday, however as an exempt-level position, additional hours will be required as needed to perform job duties. This position will also include on-call coverage that may include weekends and holidays. This position is hybrid.Job SummaryThe EHR Analysts (Clinical Applications) will be responsible for executing the system development life cycle ( SDLC ) of EpicCare Ambulatory and the Wisdom application in the College of Dentistry. This includes but is not limited to, conducting the Epic system build, system configuration, and support the workflow design. This role will develop and maintain documentation in accordance with service management standards, policies, and procedures of the business. The analyst will ensure system design requirements and documentation is synchronized with workflow changes. Analysts will actively participate in all phases and activities related to their scope of work within the SDLC . This role will execute a quality management plan tailored to the specific area of responsibility. This role will participate in operational and integrated workgroups to assess user feedback, gather requirements for configuration, and review / audit system build. The Analyst will meet regularly with team members and project leadership to discuss the status of deliverables, issues, change communications and updates. Analysts will conduct peer review of the work product and troubleshoot problems and questions to maintain a defect-free environment. Analysts will collaborate with end-users, vendor representatives, project leadership, and other teams to ensure the design, build, and implementation is successful and meets the needs of the business.This position is hybrid.Skills / Knowledge / AbilitiesThe ideal candidate will possess experience working with complex processes; a positive attitude and willingness to work hard; dedication and commitment; ability to build relationships and foster collaboration among multiple stakeholders; adaptability and resilience; critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills; exceptional planning and organizational skills; excellent written and verbal communication skills; and the ability to work with diverse groups to meet University-focused objectives. Epic certification and/or work experience.Does this position have supervisory responsibilities?  NoPreferred Education/ExperienceThe ideal candidate will have a Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Business Administration, Health Administration and/or Healthcare with minimum 5 years of healthcare, information technology, or related experience.Deadline to Apply 04/21/2024University Community of InclusionThe University of Kentucky is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce by ensuring all our students, faculty, and staff work in an environment of openness and acceptance. We strive to foster a community where people of all backgrounds, identities, and perspectives can feel secure and welcome. We also value the well-being of each of our employees and are dedicated to creating a healthy place to work, learn and live. In the interest of maintaining a safe and healthy environment for our students, employees, patients and visitors the University of Kentucky is a Tobacco & Drug Free campus.As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strongly encourage veterans, individuals with disabilities, women, and all minorities to consider our employment opportunities.Any candidate offered a position may be required to pass pre-employment screenings as mandated by University of Kentucky Human Resources. These screenings may include a national background check and/or drug screen.#HospitalGrade

title: IT Application Development - Intern
job_description: Stored Value Solutions (SVS), a subsidiary of Corpay Inc., is a world leader in gift cards whose mission is to increase the value and impact of our clients' gift card programs. We are a pioneer in the industry with 25+ years of experience and originate processing in more than 50 countries and more than 45 currencies. SVS serves more than 25% of the top 250 Global Retailers and 35 of the Top 100 US Retailers.SVS is focuses exclusively on discovering and delivering better ways for retailers and restaurants to maximize revenue from their stored value programs. Our continued investment in people, technology, operations, and new products directly benefits our clients by delivering the latest technology, the highest level of service, and the most effective ways to engage and delight consumers across multiple channels.We never stop trying to find ways to make stored value more attractive, more fun, more engaging, easier to buy, easier to use, more rewarding to give, and more iron-clad when it comes to preventing fraud. In fact, over the past 5 years, we have invested millions of dollars in new solutions for our clients. Our chief focus in these investments has been in the areas that have the greatest impact on our clients: Our Technology, Our Analytics, Our Fraud Prevention Solutions, and â€“ most importantly â€“ Our People.We are seeking an energetic, responsible intern to join our Application Development team. The position is to provide real-world experience in the work force. The individual will support the IT staff in software, hardware and all other technological tasks and issues.The IT Application Development Intern would be responsible for the development and upkeep of our client-facing applications. The two primary products you would work with would be our digital gift card delivery system as well as our Balance Inquiry infrastructure, both of which are highly visible products and some of our most utilized. The technology stacks for both products include HTML, CSS, React, Java and SQL. The developer will be exposed to all these languages to varying degrees. The developer will also be required to communicate frequently with clients as they coordinate on page design and functionality.IT interns must have an interest in pursuing a degree in computer science, information technology or engineering. The intern must have strong verbal and written communication skills, be self-directed and ready to tackle new projects and ideas.About The CompanyFLEETCOR Technologies, Inc. (â€œFLEETCORâ€) is a leading global provider of business payment solutions. We help companies of all sizes control, simplify and secure payment of various domestic and cross-border payables using specialized payment products. We serve businesses, partners, merchants, consumers and payment networks in North America, Latin America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. $2.8B Annual Revenue  800,000 Directly Served Business Clients  9,700+ Employees (as of December 31, 2021)Our payment solutions provide our customers with a payment method designed to be superior to and more robust and effective than what they use currently, whether they use a competitorâ€™s product or another alternative method such as cash or check. We group our payment solutions into five primary categories: Fuel, Lodging, Tolls, Corporate Payments and Gift. Each category is unique in its focus, customer base and target markets, but they also share a number of characteristics: customers are primarily businesses, have recurring revenue models, have specialized networks which create barriers to entry, have high margins, and have similar selling systems.FLEETCOR Enjoys Global Recognition Including Forbes Global Growth Champion â€“ FLEETCOR is one of the 250 fastest growing companies in the world as determined by Forbes and Statista  Forbes Worldâ€™s Most Innovative Companies â€“ FLEETCOR has made this prestigious list of leading innovative companies 4 years in a row!  Fortune 1000 Company â€“ FLEETCOR was one of the largest movers in the new rankings of the largest companies in America, ranking#872  S&P 500 â€“ In 2018, FLEETCOR joined the S&P stock index comprised of the 500 leading US stocks  Our Mission Create better ways for businesses and their partners to pay their expenses Our StrategyFLEETCOR will continue double-digit revenue growth by executing on four growth planks: Sell More New Clients. FLEETCOR will continue growing sales by investing more in proven sales channels and bringing more prospects into the funnel.  Increase Revenue per Client. FLEETCOR will continue increasing its share of customer wallets through network expansion and cross-sell of add-on solutions.  "Beyond" Adjacent Segments. FLEETCOR will continue extending its existing business into adjacent spaces to broaden its market opportunity.  Launch New Platform Business. FLEETCOR has launched its "new platform business" integration "Expense Management & AP/Vendor Payments" solutions into one bundled software platform.  Our Commitment to Diversity, Equality, Inclusion, Belonging Together We Can Foster True Belonging.We Know Different Ideas, Perspectives And Backgrounds Lead To Better Innovation And Results. We Are Therefore Committed To Building And Nurturing a Culture Of Diversity, Inclusion, And Belonging By Welcoming people of different backgrounds, cultures, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations;  Empowering our people to share their experiences and ideas through open forums and individual conversations; and  Valuing each personâ€™s unique perspectives and individual contributions. Embracing diversity enables our people to â€œmake the differenceâ€ at FLEETCOR. Our ValuesFLEETCORâ€™s Culture Reflects Our History Of Fast Growth And Our Continued Drive For Results. Our Entrepreneurial Spirit Remains Strong Across Our Global Workforce, And We Reinforce These Principles In Our Five Core Values Innovation: Figure out a better way  Execution: Get it done quickly  Integrity: Do the right thing  People: We make the difference  Collaboration: Accomplish more together These values guide all of our employees and are infused in all aspects of our Company. We are, as a team, united through these shared values and our mission to provide â€œa better way to pay.â€Our values foster an inclusive culture through the expectation that all employees will treat each other with respect and appreciate the diversity of identities, thoughts, backgrounds and styles. Our commitment to fostering an inclusive culture has never been more essential than in this moment of national reflection.We must always celebrate the diversity of our company and our communities.We strongly believe that the quality and diversity of our workforce provide FLEETCOR with a competitive advantage, and that our problem-solving and solution-building efforts are greatly enhanced when we harness the collective thinking of a diverse group of people with unique experiences and perspectives.Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action EmployerFLEETCOR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. FLEETCOR provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, gender (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, language, ancestry, genetic information, veteran and/or military status or any other group status protected by federal or local law.If you require reasonable accommodation for the application and/or interview process, please notify a representative of the Human Resources Department.For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity and pay transparency, please click the following links: EEO and Pay Transparency .Apply Now

job_description: Infineon Technologies Americas Corp. is seeking a IT Business Systems Analyst â€“ CRM (Lexington, KY) to serve as an integral member of our global IT team to ensure running of overall sales process with existing and future IT landscape. Infineon Technologies Americas Corp. is seeking a IT Business Systems Analyst â€“ CRM (Lexington, KY) to serve as an integral member of our global IT team to ensure running of overall sales process with existing and future IT landscape. Responsible for running a close integration with global IT and business teams located in different time zones. Assist the business in writing the requirements and converting them into technical documents, which will be used by external vendors to implement and ensure the business functionalities are carried forward. title: Security Engineer
job_description: We are looking for a seasoned Security Engineer with expertise in managing and enhancing security infrastructure to protect against advanced cyber threats. title: System Planning Engineer
job_description: *To access Dayforce at its best, log in from the latest version of Chrome, Safari, Firefox, or Edge.*Boardwalk is a limited partnership operating in the midstream portion of the natural gas and natural gas liquids industry, providing transportation and storage services for our customers. Our 14,000 miles of pipeline and storage assets provide diverse market connectivity to producers and end-users who need reliable sources of natural gas for power generation, home heating or petrochemical feedstocks. We have the experience, knowledge, and flexibility to design service offerings and create system enhancements tailored to our customersâ€™ needs throughout the 13 states in which we operate. As an organization focused on sustainability, we are committed to protecting the environment while delivering this energy source. This commitment is made to our customers, employees, and the communities in which we operate. We incorporate environmental stewardship, safety, and compliance into our day-to-day operations and seek to strengthen and support the communities we serve. Additional information about the company can be found online at www.bwpipelines.com.We are currently looking for a System Planning Engineer for our Owensboro, KY office.POSITION DESCRIPTION:Use pipeline simulation tools to determine incremental facility designs for Boardwalk Pipelines. Develop, request, and review cost estimates for incremental facilities. Provide support for FERC filings associated with new facilities or services. Utilize data analytics & data science to improve system designs and develop forecasts for business needs. Development of automated processes and systems to improve system hydraulic modeling. Determine and approve firm pipeline capacity for Boardwalk Pipelines and evaluate firm capacity impact of scheduled and unscheduled facility outages. Review feasibility of operational improvements in conjunction with proposed expansions. Provide direct assistance with maintenance planning, including operational support to Gas Control management.REQUIRED SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND EXPERIENCE:Strong technical aptitude and computer skillsEffective communication skills to interact cross-functionallyGood interpersonal skills to work in team environmentPREFERRED SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND EXPERIENCE:2 or more years of engineering experience, including energy industryData analytics and data science aptitudeComputer/hydraulic modeling experienceREQUIRED EDUCATION:Bachelor of Science in Engineering or comparable technical fieldADDITIONAL INFORMATION:Boardwalk Pipelines, LP maintains a drug-free workplace and will require pre-employment drug & substance abuse testing before hire.Boardwalk Pipelines, LP is an equal opportunity / affirmative action employer. All applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

title: IT Field Engineer
job_description: Job DescriptionThe IT Field Engineer extends technical expertise to all customers through deployment and troubleshooting of technology. They are responsible for not only troubleshooting problems faced by the end-users of PCs, laptops, servers and mobile phones, but also understanding client business models to identify critical systems for continuity planning purposes. Field Engineers receive assignments through emails, telephone or in-person, as they are often a technical account management point-of-contact for any customer following onboarding.Part of Pelyconâ€™s mission is to be a great provider of IT and Cybersecurity services and what separates the great from the good is the people. If customers arenâ€™t comfortable and confident with the people, theyâ€™ve entrusted to manage their technology and guard their data, then the rest doesnâ€™t matter. Pelycon builds valued and lasting relationships with clients, working with them as an extension of their team so their business to succeed and thrive. We are engineers, which means we solve problems.Job ResponsibilitiesField Engineers manage projects, design solutions, research and diagnose problems and understand client business models to be an advocate for technology solutions that support the business mission. They document user requests and update client trouble tickets with the current status of the issue, keeping users informed about the status of their tickets/requests and confirm the resolution. They also undertake maintenance of computer networks, hardware, software, and other equipment at regular intervals.Duties Include:Plan, execute and manage projects to deploy technology solutions, upgrades and migrations. Research and analysis of technical problems for end users, documentation and resolution or escalation. Act as an escalation point for troubleshooting. Use of ticketing system, and technical knowledgebase to track and document all incidents. Install, assess, troubleshoot, maintain, and upgrade computers and equipment of different types, including copiers, printers, and scanners. Ownership of appropriate documentation to facilitate quickly troubleshooting all problems. Other administrative duties as assigned. Skills Required:Strong communication skills in order to work with both IT specialists and non-IT employees. Lifelong learner mindset to learn and support new technology and demonstrate knowledge through obtaining industry relevant certifications. Strong organization and multi-task tracking skills. Reliable work ethic. Excellent customer service skills (courteous, tactful, and professional demeanor). Ability to participate in on call rotation involving responding to high priority alerts after hours and weekends (additional compensation). Developing subject matter expertise in Windows, Mac, Servers and Networking. Developing subject matter expertise in of Microsoft Active Directory. Cybersecurity hygiene and safe computing practices. Antivirus, backup and disaster recovery, patching, MS office. Knowledge and experience with Cloud hosted and on-premises email server support. Knowledge and experience with Office 365 setup and support. Developing business knowledge in one or more verticalsAdditional Desired Skills:Knowledge and experience with Point-of-sale systems support. Knowledge and experience with Azure cloud. Knowledge and experience working with Cybersecurity controls and compliance frameworks. Fundamental knowledge of a programming or scripting language. Educational Qualifications and Certifications:A bachelorâ€™s degree is preferred for this position, an associate degree, experience and certifications can substitute. Candidates should have at least five years of experience in information technology surroundings. Willingness to assume a leadership role and mentor and learn from a team of technicians. Company DescriptionPelycon is a fast-growing IT managed services provider servicing clients in Lexington and its surrounding counties, and Louisville. Offering a competitive salary and benefit package commensurate with experience and education, we are looking for technicians that enjoy helping businesses thrive and solving technical problems that can lead to downtime.Pelycon is a fast-growing IT managed services provider servicing clients in Lexington and its surrounding counties, and Louisville. Offering a competitive salary and benefit package commensurate with experience and education, we are looking for technicians that enjoy helping businesses thrive and solving technical problems that can lead to downtime.

title: Technical Solutions Engineer
job_description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance.Problem-solving with a purpose.As a Technical Solutions Engineer at Epic, youâ€™ll work on software that impacts 305 million patients around the world. Alongside customer counterparts, youâ€™ll tackle mission-critical and complex problems â€“ weâ€™re way beyond â€œturn it off and on againâ€ issues. Youâ€™ll need to diagnose the problem, identify a solution, and manage the implementation of the solution, sometimes across multiple physical locations and stakeholders. Learn more about our team at https //careers.epic.com/Jobs/Technical-Solutions-Engineer.Test the limits of your brain for the most innovative health systems on the planet.The top-ranked health systems in U.S. News and World Report are Epic customers. Our community includes major systems like the Mayo Clinic, Johns Hopkins, Cleveland Clinic, and Kaiser Permanente, as well as leading academic medical centers at the University of Wisconsin, University of Michigan, University of California, University of Texas, The Ohio State University, and many more.Experience our state-of-the-art campus, eat delicious food, and travel the world.We donâ€™t believe in cubicles. (Well, we believe they exist, butâ€¦) Our uniquely themed campus was designed to heighten your ability to get stuff done in your office, a conference room, or by the fireplace in a comfy chair. For lunch, visit Kingâ€™s Cross or Cassiopeia for a wide array of meal options, or go to one of our smaller, themed bistros, featuring wood-rotisserie, pan-Asian, and Latin-inspired cuisine. All meals are restaurant-quality but cost only a few dollars, and theyâ€™re prepared by a team comprised of kitchen talent from restaurants around the country. And, after five years here, youâ€™ll earn a four-week sabbatical anywhere in the world. Staff have kayaked in Patagonia, attended a BeyoncÃ© concert in Ireland, built a library in Tanzania, and run a marathon in Antarctica.Live affordably in a city known for its rising tech talent.Epic is located just outside Madison, Wisconsin, which is the second fastest growing market for tech talent in the United States, home to the state capital, and the University of Wisconsin. Madison has received accolades for being the greenest city in America (NerdWallet), the best city for renters (SmartAsset), the fittest city in America (Fitbit), and it has the highest concentration of millennial talent in the country (Inc.).More than just important work.We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. title: Junior Virtualization Engineer
job_description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance.We are looking for a VMware Engineer to join our multi-tenant, industry-leading, hosting team managing an environment of over 6000 hosts and over 65,000 virtual machines. Youâ€™ll apply your technical prowess and problem-solving skills to develop and maintain a robust, reliable, high-performance foundation for some of the largest healthcare organizations in the country to access our world-class software. Our multi-tenant, ever-growing environment scales through our code-first, DevOps focused culture. Spend more time automating and orchestrating and less time performing point-and-click tasks.As part of Epic's hosting team, you'll enjoy opportunities to keep abreast of the latest technologies. You'll collaborate with infrastructure teams from traditional networking to storage administration to influence the design of our high-performance systems that ultimately allow healthcare providers to better do what they do best - take great care of patients. Shifted hours available. Learn more about the team at https //careers.epic.com/Jobs/Hosting.As an Epic employee, you'll get to experience our state-of-the-art campus, eat delicious food, and improve healthcare for the world. We don't believe in cubicles here at Epic but instead believe that your best work is done in a spot that works for you. Whether it be working in your office, a conference room, or in our hosting facility, there are plenty of places to do important work that is helping healthcare organizations improve care for patients. Our award-winning culinary team will keep you well fed with meals prepared by top culinary talent and our sabbatical program will ensure you are able to travel to global destinations you've always wanted to visit.More than just important work.Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.This position features two different starting points, based upon prior experience.Junior VMware Engineer requires 0-2 years of experience in the followingVMware Engineer requires 2+ years of experience in the followingExposure to VMware vSphereExperience or interest in scripting and automation with tools such as vSphere PowerCLI, GoLang, or PythonAdditional RequirementsStrong individual and collaborative troubleshooting skillsRelocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed)Eligibility to work in the US without visa sponsorshipCOVID-19 vaccinationAs a member of the Hosting team at Epic you'll be responsible for the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of Epic Hosting. Those responsibilities include:Following policies and procedures and escalating when policies or procedures are not followedEscalating potential security incidents and providing relevant informationMeeting all security responsibilities defined in policies and procedures
