title: Pediatric Disaster Care Preparedness Data Analyst, CAHRDS Operations, Days
job_description: ResponsibilitiesThis position supports Norton Children's in its capacity as the Trauma and Burn Hub of the Regional Pediatric Pandemic Network and local/state/regional/national activities. Together with the Principal Investigator (PI)/Medical Director and all aspects of the program at Norton Childrenâ€™s, the role will participate in regional meetings along with participants at other sites. This role will liaise with project managers and medical directors from the Emergency Medical Services for Children Innovation and Improvement Center, National Association of State EMS Officials, American College of Surgeon Committee on Trauma, and other network sites, to identify gaps in care including rehabilitation and burn care, and increase trauma preparedness. This position will work to convert the current database that exists in spreadsheet format into a RedCap database with real-time capabilities for access and updates by state officials. Incorporation of this database into the PPN network emphasizes integration of pediatric trauma care into existing adult trauma system infrastructure. This role will interpret and translate data into next steps including implementation through state systems or future funding initiatives. The trauma system network will provide the framework for regional partnerships and national momentum for system building and trauma preparedness. This is a time-limited position dedicated to a specific project. Further employment after the completion of the grant-funded project is not guaranteed.QualificationsRequired:1 year experience working in data analytics, biomedical informatics, data science, or related. Bachelor degree Desired1 year in healthcare OR public health OR emergency services. 1 year experience in pediatrics emergency medical services/trauma. Master degree Certified Clinical Research Associate , Certified Clinical Research Coordinator, Certified Clinical Research Professional

title: Data Developer
job_description: Job Description:  Responsibilities:      Developing, maintaining, and managing advanced reporting, analytics, dashboards, and other BI solutions. A solid understanding of SQL, rational databases, and normalization.     Proficiency in the use of query and reporting analysis tools. Outstanding oral, written, and listening skills.     Understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies and their interaction with business processes.     Experience working with collaborative teams in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and the flexibility to change priorities when needed.

title: Asst Dir, Data Integrity
job_description: Title: Asst Dir, Data IntegrityPosition Type: Fulltime StaffSearch Type: Internal - minimum 5 daysDepartment: 39G100 - Sponsored Programs-Restricted FundsDivision: 2G0000 - Academic Affairs-RestrictedPosition Location: Richmond CampusDriver Classification: Non-DriverFLSA: ExemptSchedule TypeHours Per Week:Additional Schedule DetailsPosted Salary Grade: Exempt - 48Retirement: KTRSContact Person: susan.barber@eku.eduJob Summary/Basic FunctionsThe Assistant Director is responsible for the overall management and direction of the Training Records Information System (TRIS).Minimum QualificationsEducation: Master's Degree in a related field is required.Experience: Minimum of three years of related experience with at least one year of supervisory experience is required.Proficiency in SQL utilizing transactionsLicensure & CertificationsPreferred Qualifications:Job Duties60% - The Assistant Director provides the TRIS Unit with oversight and direction in completing project assignments; including the quality, integrity and accuracy of all data entered into the TRIS system. Provide management of the Data Integrity Administrator, Data Integrity Analyst, and Data Integrity Specialist positions including establishing annual goals, conducting regular performance reviews and appropriate recognition, and supporting ongoing professional development opportunities. Demonstrate expert knowledge and use of TRIS systems, and assist with pulling complex lists, reports and queries, technical support and data entry as needed. Establish user protocols and standards on how to enter information to guarantee consistency and accuracy across users. Create workflows for import and input of newly acquired data. Establish and maintain procedures related to all aspects of the current and future database and integrated applications. Ensure that all procedures are disseminated to TRIS staff and followed effectively. Develop and execute training plan for TRIS staff, as necessary. Plan, implement, and supervise the collection, entry, updating, output, and usage of all demographic, training, and other information into TRIS. Lead database clean-up efforts and work with TRIS staff to maintain accurate constituent records. Establish and execute an annual data clean-up schedule. Design and produce regular and ad-hoc auditing reports as needed to support data integrity review and management. Collaborate with staff to clean up inconsistencies and errors, as well as data maintenance solutions. Track and administer accounts, system roles, security settings and permissions. Ensure regular education and adherence to data privacy, compliance laws and best practices by TRIS staff. - ()35% - Serve as the subject matter expert on all TRIS systems for the Training Resource Center to support strategic initiatives and define requirements. The Assistant Director provides database development and works with inter/intra-agency collaboration teams who provide application development input in the development process. Provides consultation and expertise for software infrastructure through the development of tables, screens and processes to facilitate functionality and flexibility of the database. Establish a comprehensive data integrity plan by identifying areas within the TRIS infrastructure where data cleaning and normalization are needed, and create a strategic plan for data integrity execution. Coordinate with TRC IT for needed support, and to ensure proper maintenance, software updates, and back-ups are occurring. Provide technical support to users as appropriate, and elevate issues to IT as needed. - ()5% - Other duties as assigned. - ()Sponsorship: This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.Funding Source: GrantOpen Until Filled: YesSpecial Instructions: The Training Resource Center (TRC) provides training and support for Kentucky's Department for Community Based Services. The funding for this position is from federal and/or state funds and is subject to annual renewal. This is a contract EKU position. The position may be considered for full time remote or hybrid work arrangements.AA/EEO StatementEastern Kentucky University is an Equal Opportunity employer and educational institution and does not discriminate on the basis of age (40 and over), race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, ethnicity, disability, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information in the admission to, or participation in, any educational program or activity (e.g., athletics, academics and housing) which it conducts or any employment policy or practice.Background Check StatementOffers of employment are contingent upon satisfactory background check.

title: Quality Control Analyst
job_description: CONTRACTMUST HAVES:Bachelors degree om Chemistry, Biology, Chemical Engineering or Life Sciences (preferred Chemistry or Biology)Work Experience: 0-5 years in Quality, Laboratory, Clinical or Chemical manufacturing role (including internships or co-op experience).Basic knowledge of lab safety and the ability to work safely with chemicals of varying potencyPosition Overview: A QC Analytical chemist is an entry level position for individuals who use their understanding of science to perform the basic and critical experimental work of day-to-day analysis, including generation and analysis of data. Their work is hands on in an analytical lab and requires analytical testing, computer operating, record keeping, and report writing abilities. This position performs the quality testing needed for raw material, in-process, finished goods, stability, and cleaning validation analysis.Specific Tasks, Duties and Responsibilities:Perform efficient/reliable/high quality analytical testing in accordance with USP/NF/EP/JP/FCC/etc. or customer supplied guidelines. Typical testing may include Dissolution, Titration, Polarimetry, Loss on Drying, Viscosity, Residue on Ignition, Heavy Metal Content, FTIR, HPLC, and GC, etc.Maintain accurate written records of all analysis performed.Accurately interpret and effectively communicate analytical results and issues.Schedule daily tasks in an organized and efficient manner.General knowledge of the use and operation of basic laboratory equipment.Calibrate and maintain lab equipment and instrumentation.Responsible for operating in a safe manner, must be familiar with basic laboratory and chemical hygiene practicesBecome proficient in standard operating procedures and test methods.Ability to work in a flow to the work team environment.In combination with other lab personnel, be responsible for a clean and safe work environment.Perform peer review of analytical testing and write up.Write SOPs on an as needed basis.Essential Skills and Experience: Education or Equivalent:Bachelors degree om Chemistry, Biology, Chemical Engineering or Life Sciences (preferred Chemistry or Biology).Work Experience - 0-5 years in Quality, Laboratory, Clinical or Chemical manufacturing role (including internships or co-op experience). Knowledge/Skills Requirements:Ability to multi-task with high efficiency.Ability to work well under pressure and maintain efficiency.Ability to communicate effectively.Basic knowledge of lab safety and the ability to work safely with chemicals of varying potency.General computer literacy including use of Microsoft Word and Excel.Ability to perform analytical testing while standing for long periods of time. Accurate testing on the first attempt under pressure of production details.Experience in the pharmaceutical industry preferred.

title: Field Engineer-IT
job_description: Job DescriptionThe IT Field Engineer extends technical expertise to all customers through deployment and troubleshooting of technology. They are responsible for not only troubleshooting problems faced by the end-users of PCs, laptops, servers and mobile phones, but also understanding client business models to identify critical systems for continuity planning purposes. Field Engineers receive assignments through emails, telephone or in-person, as they are often a technical account management point-of-contact for any customer following onboarding.Part of Pelyconâ€™s mission is to be a great provider of IT and Cybersecurity services and what separates the great from the good is the people. If customers arenâ€™t comfortable and confident with the people, theyâ€™ve entrusted to manage their technology and guard their data, then the rest doesnâ€™t matter. Pelycon builds valued and lasting relationships with clients, working with them as an extension of their team so their business to succeed and thrive. We are engineers, which means we solve problems.Job ResponsibilitiesField Engineers manage projects, design solutions, research and diagnose problems and understand client business models to be an advocate for technology solutions that support the business mission. They document user requests and update client trouble tickets with the current status of the issue, keeping users informed about the status of their tickets/requests and confirm the resolution. They also undertake maintenance of computer networks, hardware, software, and other equipment at regular intervals.Duties Include:Plan, execute and manage projects to deploy technology solutions, upgrades and migrations. Research and analysis of technical problems for end users, documentation and resolution or escalation. Act as an escalation point for troubleshooting. Use of ticketing system, and technical knowledgebase to track and document all incidents. Install, assess, troubleshoot, maintain, and upgrade computers and equipment of different types, including copiers, printers, and scanners. Ownership of appropriate documentation to facilitate quickly troubleshooting all problems. Other administrative duties as assigned. Skills Required:Strong communication skills in order to work with both IT specialists and non-IT employees. Lifelong learner mindset to learn and support new technology and demonstrate knowledge through obtaining industry relevant certifications. Strong organization and multi-task tracking skills. Reliable work ethic. Excellent customer service skills (courteous, tactful, and professional demeanor). Ability to participate in on call rotation involving responding to high priority alerts after hours and weekends (additional compensation). Developing subject matter expertise in Windows, Mac, Servers and Networking. Developing subject matter expertise in of Microsoft Active Directory. Cybersecurity hygiene and safe computing practices. Antivirus, backup and disaster recovery, patching, MS office. Knowledge and experience with Cloud hosted and on-premises email server support. Knowledge and experience with Office 365 setup and support. Developing business knowledge in one or more verticalsAdditional Desired Skills:Knowledge and experience with Point-of-sale systems support. Knowledge and experience with Azure cloud. Knowledge and experience working with Cybersecurity controls and compliance frameworks. Fundamental knowledge of a programming or scripting language. Educational Qualifications and Certifications:A bachelorâ€™s degree is preferred for this position, an associate degree, experience and certifications can substitute. Candidates should have at least five years of experience in information technology surroundings. Willingness to assume a leadership role and mentor and learn from a team of technicians. Company DescriptionPelycon is a fast-growing IT managed services provider servicing clients in Lexington and its surrounding counties, and Louisville. Offering a competitive salary and benefit package commensurate with experience and education, we are looking for technicians that enjoy helping businesses thrive and solving technical problems that can lead to downtime.Pelycon is a fast-growing IT managed services provider servicing clients in Lexington and its surrounding counties, and Louisville. title: Senior Implementation Analyst

integrations within the ServiceNow ecosystem to identify strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities for improvement.Collaborate with stakeholders to define clear, measurable objectives for transformation initiatives, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.Develop and maintain a roadmap for ServiceNow implementation, outlining key milestones, timelines, and deliverables.Analyze performance metrics and user feedback to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement within the ServiceNow platform.Work closely with cross-functional teams to implement changes and enhancements to the ServiceNow platform, ensuring alignment with best practices and industry standards.Provide guidance and support to end users on the use of ServiceNow platform functionalities and features.Stay current on ServiceNow platform updates, releases, and best practices, and proactively identify opportunities for optimization and innovation.Collaborate with IT teams to ensure seamless integration of ServiceNow with other systems and applications.Prepare and present regular progress reports, status updates, and recommendations to senior management and key stakeholders.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.Experience in ServiceNow implementation, configuration, and administration.Strong understanding of IT Service Management (ITSM) processes and best practices.Proficiency in ServiceNow modules such as Incident Management, Change Management, and Service Catalog.Experience with ServiceNow scripting languages (JavaScript, Glide) is preferred.Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.ServiceNow certification(s) is a plus.We are not able to provide sponsorship at this time and will not consider any unsolicited candidates.

title: Field Engineer-IT
job_description: Job DescriptionThe IT Field Engineer extends technical expertise to all customers through deployment and troubleshooting of technology. They are responsible for not only troubleshooting problems faced by the end-users of PCs, laptops, servers and mobile phones, but also understanding client business models to identify critical systems for continuity planning purposes. Field Engineers receive assignments through emails, telephone or in-person, as they are often a technical account management point-of-contact for any customer following onboarding.Part of Pelyconâ€™s mission is to be a great provider of IT and Cybersecurity services and what separates the great from the good is the people. If customers arenâ€™t comfortable and confident with the people, theyâ€™ve entrusted to manage their technology and guard their data, then the rest doesnâ€™t matter. Pelycon builds valued and lasting relationships with clients, working with them as an extension of their team so their business to succeed and thrive. We are engineers, which means we solve problems.Job ResponsibilitiesField Engineers manage projects, design solutions, research and diagnose problems and understand client business models to be an advocate for technology solutions that support the business mission. They document user requests and update client trouble tickets with the current status of the issue, keeping users informed about the status of their tickets/requests and confirm the resolution. They also undertake maintenance of computer networks, hardware, software, and other equipment at regular intervals.Duties Include:Plan, execute and manage projects to deploy technology solutions, upgrades and migrations. Research and analysis of technical problems for end users, documentation and resolution or escalation. Act as an escalation point for troubleshooting. Use of ticketing system, and technical knowledgebase to track and document all incidents. Install, assess, troubleshoot, maintain, and upgrade computers and equipment of different types, including copiers, printers, and scanners. Ownership of appropriate documentation to facilitate quickly troubleshooting all problems. Other administrative duties as assigned. Skills Required:Strong communication skills in order to work with both IT specialists and non-IT employees. Lifelong learner mindset to learn and support new technology and demonstrate knowledge through obtaining industry relevant certifications. Strong organization and multi-task tracking skills. Reliable work ethic. Excellent customer service skills (courteous, tactful, and professional demeanor). Ability to participate in on call rotation involving responding to high priority alerts after hours and weekends (additional compensation). Developing subject matter expertise in Windows, Mac, Servers and Networking. Developing subject matter expertise in of Microsoft Active Directory. Cybersecurity hygiene and safe computing practices. Antivirus, backup and disaster recovery, patching, MS office. Knowledge and experience with Cloud hosted and on-premises email server support. Knowledge and experience with Office 365 setup and support. Developing business knowledge in one or more verticalsAdditional Desired Skills:Knowledge and experience with Point-of-sale systems support. Knowledge and experience with Azure cloud. Knowledge and experience working with Cybersecurity controls and compliance frameworks. Fundamental knowledge of a programming or scripting language. Educational Qualifications and Certifications:A bachelorâ€™s degree is preferred for this position, an associate degree, experience and certifications can substitute. Candidates should have at least five years of experience in information technology surroundings. Willingness to assume a leadership role and mentor and learn from a team of technicians. Company DescriptionPelycon is a fast-growing IT managed services provider servicing clients in Lexington and its surrounding counties, and Louisville. Offering a competitive salary and benefit package commensurate with experience and education, we are looking for technicians that enjoy helping businesses thrive and solving technical problems that can lead to downtime.Pelycon is a fast-growing IT managed services provider servicing clients in Lexington and its surrounding counties, and Louisville. Offering a competitive salary and benefit package commensurate with experience and education, we are looking for technicians that enjoy helping businesses thrive and solving technical problems that can lead to downtime.

title: Supply Chain Analyst

RequirementsKey skills and experience required:Bachelorâ€™s degree with a focus in Supply Chain Management, Finance, or Engineering1+ years of working in a Manufacturing environment. Preferred Industries: Food and Beverage, Food production, Wine and Spirits, Dairy or Nutraceuticals 2+ years of experience in Supply Chain functions Supply chain management, vendor relations and production planning or related job1+ years of Project Management experience at a CPG company or other related industry. 1+ years of ERP experience (Preferably SAP S/4HANA, Netsuit)Create excel models and routine level reports. Responsible for data and report accuracy and expected to find errors in data; investigate and develop robust controls to mitigate future errors. Responsible for improving current processes. Excellent collaborator and relationship builder; internal and external. Excellent planning, root cause analysis/problem solving, and organizational skills. Ability to travel as needed. Has a demonstrated passion that align with the core values of Alani Nu. BenefitsCompetitive SalaryPaid Time off (3 weeks plus 8 paid holidays)Paid Parental Leave up to 6 weeks. 401(k) Plan with Employer MatchFree ProductsAND MUCH MORE!Health Benefits:MedicalVisionDentalLife InsuranceDisabilityHASFSADependent Care FSA #PRIMECongo Brands, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, or any other classification protected by Federal, state, or local law.

title: NGB Liaison Officer
job_description: National Guard Bureau Liaison Officer (LNO) The NGB LNO is responsible for coordination and reporting between the TAP Program Office and the National Guard Bureau supporting organizational efficiency, and development, and the following responsibilities:Consolidate, analyze, query, and report information provided by TAP stakeholders regarding program operations, statistics, and performance of program clients and initiatives. Upload and assist with the management of data in the Knowledge Management portal/SharePoint. Coordinate with public affairs regarding marketing information and advertisement of the transition program. Education: Bachelorâ€™s degree in business or similar field.Experience: 7-9 years of experience in an analyst position for a Federal Agency, plus an understanding of DoD policies and regulations including the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA).

title: L3 Infrastructure Engineer
job_description: Tier 3 (L3) IT infra support is the final line of support and comprises a technical team that deals with technical problems. Troubleshooting , configuration, database administration, and repair for server, network, infrastructure, Data Center, email, file shares, and other infrastructure issues. Besides always having the ability to deploy solutions to new problems, a Level 3 tech usually has the most expertise in a company and is the go-to person for solving difficult issues.With years of experience, the L3 experts can manage and resolve almost any problem that requires high expertise. They can also control the infrastructure, cloud, network, and DC level operations. All the high-end administration tasks are secure in their hands, and it is advisable to have at least an L3 level technician as a team leader in every operation. These engineers use requirements and aim to replicate problems to detect the root cause. They have access to the highest technological support for fixing issues or developing new features. Their team mainly consists of chief engineers who designed the product or service.

job_description: Advertisement Closes5/11/2024 (8:00 PM EDT)24-02664Resource Management Analyst IPay Grade 13Salary$3,085.72 - $4,628.66 MonthlyEmployment TypeEXECUTIVE BRANCH | FULL TIME | ELIGIBLE FOR OVERTIME PAY | 18A | 37.5 HR/WKClick here for more details on state employment.Hiring AgencyTransportation Cabinet | Department of HighwaysLocation200 Mero StFrankfort, KY 40622 USADescriptionThe Kentucky Transportation Cabinet is committed to meeting or exceeding the needs and expectations of our customers. title: FDC/SPC Specialist - (3+ years experience - python, SQL, java, hadoop) - Glendale, KY
job_description: Role And ResponsibilitiesFDC System Development & Implementation: Lead the development, testing, and deployment of AI and dat-driven solutions for the Fault Detection & Classification system, specifically for early detection and analysis of process/equipment anomalies. SPC System Development & Implementation: Drive the development, testing, and rollout of AI and dat-centric solutions for the Statistical Process Control system, aiming to manage variations for statistical quality control. Statistical Analysis & Optimization: Utilize AI algorithms and methods to develop statistical models that analyze, monitor, and control production processes to ensure quality. Predictive Analysis & Optimization: Harness AI tools and methods to develop predictive models that preempt process or equipment faults, ensuring maximum uptime and efficiency. Data Management & Analysis: Design and manage robust database structures catering to the FDC system, utilizing languages and tools like Python, SQL, and TensorFlow. User Experience & Interface Development: Devise intuitive AI-driven interfaces for system operators to swiftly identify and react to potential faults, ensuring seamless operational flow. Troubleshooting & Maintenance: Address FDC-related software challenges promptly and implement periodic system updates to guarantee optimized performance. Continuous Learning & Training: Remain at the forefront of evolving trends in AI, data engineering, and FDC technologies. Conduct relevant training sessions and lend unwavering support to teams. Skill And QualificationsBachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science, Data Science, or a relevant discipline. 3 - 6 years of hands-on experience in AI modeling and data engineering, preferably within fault detection or similar systems. Mastery in programming, particularly in Python, SQL, R, and Java. Extensive knowledge in leveraging data tools suck as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hadoop, and Spark. Superior teamwork, collaboration, and communication acumen. Innate problem-solving capability with agility in dynamic scenarios. An analytical mindset with the ability to decipher complex statistical data.

title: Senior Supply Chain Analyst

within project management software, for monthly financial reporting on multiple New Builds and Retrofit projects on campus.Manage external project budget and communications within external project reports.Manage monthly vendor invoice review process within invoicing software, including project management review, 3rd party auditing services, and communication with Accounts Payable.Responsible to compare financial forecasts and risks are in alignment with schedule updates.Assistance with programmatic initiatives, training, and alignment opportunities.QualificationsBA/BS or equivalent in construction management or engineering.Demonstrated working experience in construction and project planning for large multi-project construction programs.Strong collaboration skills and problem-solving mindset.Experienced with Primavera P6, Microsoft Office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word) and Google Suite.Must be familiar with a cost control tooling (such as eBuilder, Procore, or others).Ability to clearly communicate financial status and schedule details from multiple construction sites to project managers.Excellent communication, presentation, and analytical skills are a must in this highly collaborative role.Additional InformationOn-site presence and requirements may change depending on our client's needs.Our inspired people share our vision and mission. title: Scientist II
job_description: Posting DetailsJob Title Scientist IIRequisition Number RE45163Working Title Bone Lab ManagerDepartment Name 7H362:INTERNAL MEDICINE & DIVISIONS - NEPHROLOWork Location Lexington, KYGrade Level 46Salary Range $51,491-84,950/yearType of Position StaffPosition Time Status  Full-TimeRequired EducationPhDClick here for more information about equivalencies: https://hr.uky.edu/employment/working-uk/equivalenciesRequired Related ExperienceNo experience required.Required License/Registration/CertificationNonePhysical RequirementsThe essential functions for this position require: sitting at a computer workstation for extended periods of time, performing repetitive motions (such as typing), and working in a laboratory setting.ShiftPrimarily day shift Monday through Friday with additional hours as required to meet department needs.Job SummaryThe Department of Internal Medicineâ€™s Division of Nephrology is seeking a highly qualified individual to aid in the management of bone studies. Key responsibilities encompass a wide array of tasks, including processing research samples, conducting experiments in a timely manner, and maintaining laboratory equipment. Ensuring accurate data entry, analyzing experiment results, and coordinating with colleagues on experimental procedures are integral aspects of the role.Moreover, the Research Analyst will be tasked with maintaining Institutional Review Board ( IRB ) approval, overseeing recordkeeping for studies, and facilitating communication with study personnel. Regular attendance at research meetings to discuss findings, coordination of patient scheduling, and receiving biopsy and blood samples for research purposes are also part of the positionâ€™s duties.Regulatory responsibilities include preparing annual reports, ensuring compliance with relevant standards (such as CAP and CLIA ), and managing regulatory documentation for clinical staff and IRB review. Collaboration with principal investigators (PIs) and research teams across various projects is vital for developing and implementing processes and protocols. Additionally, this individual will assist in protocol data management, including the preparation and presentation of outcomes data for specific protocols.The role extends to supporting the goals of nephrology research by conducting experiments utilizing genetic and molecular biology techniques, contributing to scientific project development, and drafting scientific papers. Furthermore, the position involves managing the overall operation of federally funded research, which encompasses developing operational manuals and work plans aligned with study objectives, overseeing daily operations, supervising lab staff, and maintaining research databases.Additionally, responsibilities include coordinating regulatory reviews, preparing reports for sponsors and stakeholders, and organizing research team meetings. Acting as a liaison to advisory council members and stakeholders, as well as preparing manuscripts and presentations of study findings, are integral components of the role. Overall, this position plays a crucial role in advancing nephrology research objectives through meticulous experimentation, regulatory compliance, and effective collaboration.Skills / Knowledge / AbilitiesThe ideal candidate will demonstrate:Excellent communication skillsExperience in regulatory documentation and complianceProficiency in genetic and molecular biology techniquesFamiliarity with mouse colonies and small animal surgeriesAbility to manage federally funded research operationsStrong organizational and leadership skillsDoes this position have supervisory responsibilities?  YesPreferred Education/ExperiencePhD in Biology, Biochemistry, or related field preferred; alternatively, Masterâ€™s degree with 3+ years of research experience will be considered. Expertise in bone studies, genetic/molecular biology, and small animal surgeries highly preferred. Experience managing federally funded research projects and regulatory compliance desirable. Ability to collaborate effectively, and proficiency in data analysis and presentation preferred. Track record of scientific publications and manuscript preparation preferred. Proficiency in techniques such as histology, immunochemistry, FTIR , microindentation, and nanoindentation highly preferred. Deadline to Apply 05/15/2024University Community of InclusionThe University of Kentucky is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce by ensuring all our students, faculty, and staff work in an environment of openness and acceptance. We strive to foster a community where people of all backgrounds, identities, and perspectives can feel secure and welcome. We also value the well-being of each of our employees and are dedicated to creating a healthy place to work, learn and live. In the interest of maintaining a safe and healthy environment for our students, employees, patients and visitors the University of Kentucky is a Tobacco & Drug Free campus.As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strongly encourage veterans, individuals with disabilities, women, and all minorities to consider our employment opportunities.Any candidate offered a position may be required to pass pre-employment screenings as mandated by University of Kentucky Human Resources. These screenings may include a national background check and/or drug screen.

title: IT SPECIALIST (CUSTOMER SUPPORT) - TITLE 32 with Security Clearance
job_description: Duties As a IT SPECIALIST (CUSTOMER SUPPORT) - TITLE 32, GS-2210-9, you will install, configure, troubleshoot, and provide maintenance in response to customer requirements. Provide initial incident information to the Incident Response Specialty. Provide basic support for end-user hardware failures. Re-image customer workstations and resolve basic problems. Use programs and techniques to isolate causes of problems and user errors. Detect damaged or lost files, optimize disk management, measure system performance, control system security, and/or extend system capabilities to support local requirements. Troubleshoot and repair IT implementing Army standards and accepted practices. Notify team leader of significant trends in hardware/software implementation issues and any potential problems. Install, test, and prepare performance reports and recommendations on equipment. Work with users to test and evaluate software packages. Provide support and guidance on operating computers, equipment, and associated software. Receive, respond to, and ensure resolution of help center calls. Perform other duties as assigned. A more comprehensive detailed description of the position may be found in Position Description PDD2525P01 on file in the employing unit or in the Human Resources Office. Contact the KY HRO Staffing Section via email for additional information,Requirements Conditions of Employment Military Grades: E5 (SGT) - O4 (MAJ) CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT: You must maintain membership in the Kentucky National Guard. You must be assigned to a compatible military position. Wear of the military uniform. Position may require a pre-employment physical. May be subject to furlough actions. May be required to successfully complete a probationary period. Participation in direct deposit is mandatory. Must obtain and maintain a favorable adjudication of a T3 or equivalent investigation. Acceptance of a Federal position may terminate a military bonus. Acceptance of a Federal position will terminate Tricare Reserve Select (TRS) eligibility. This position is located on a tobacco free facility. This position is covered by the Domestic Violence Misdemeanor Amendment (30 Sep 96) of the Gun Control Act (Lautenberg Amendment) of 19An individual convicted of a qualifying crime of domestic violence may not perform the duties of this position. This position conducts information assurance functions. The incumbent shall comply with the requirements of the certification program and will be required to obtain and maintain certification. Certification requirements are outlined in DOD instruction 8570.01-M. Must obtain and maintain Security+ Certification within six (6) months of appointment. Qualifications MINIMUM REQUIREMENT: Experience that has provided a basic knowledge of data processing functions and general management principles that enabled the applicant to understand the stages required to automate a work process. Experience may have been gained in work such as computer operator or assistant, computer sales representative, program analyst, or other positions that required the use or adaptation of computer programs and systems. SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE: Must have at least 24 months experience in analysis of the interrelationship of pertinent components of the system. Experience planning the sequence of actions necessary to accomplish the assignment. Experience scheduling the sequence of programs to be processed by computers where alternatives had to be weighed with a view to production efficiency. EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: Resume must have complete dates (Example 2 JAN 1980 to 3 MAR 1981 or JAN 1980 to MAR 1981), work schedule, and hours worked per week of employment. Use of year only and unspecified work schedule will result in disqualification. Each applicant must fully substantiate -in their own words- that they meet 100% of the minimum requirements and specialized experience listed above in detail; otherwise, the applicant will be considered unqualified for this position. Do NOT copy and paste from the vacancy announcement or the position description. Also, make sure the applicant's name is on every document submitted, otherwise it will NOT be considered. Education Substitution of Education for Specialized Experience: To qualify for GS-2210 Title 32 Excepted Service positions, on the basis of completed graduate education listed below. Masters or equivalent graduate degree -OR- 2 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree All undergraduate or graduate education must be in computer science, engineering, information science, information systems management, mathematics, operations research, statistics, or technology management or degree that provided a minimum of 24 semester hours in one or more of the fields identified above and required the development or adaptation of applications, systems or networks. To receive credit for education, you must provide OFFICIAL transcripts. Additional information If you are a male applicant who was born after 12/31/1959 and are required to register under the Military Selective Service Act, the Defense Authorization Act of 1986 requires that you be registered or you are not eligible for appointment in this agency ( http://www.sss.gov/RegVer/wfRegistration.aspx ).Benefits Help A career with the U.S. government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. title: Library Programmer - Young Adult
job_description: Kenton County Public Library is seeking applicants for the full-time position of Young Adult Programmer at the Erlanger Branch. The Young Adult Programmer will be tasked with improving and adding to the already rich experiences and offerings of the branch, including high quality programming, reference service, readers' advisory, circulation services, and technology assistance. title: Software Engineer
job_description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance.Code that saves lives. As a software developer at Epic, youâ€™ll write software that impacts the lives of 75% of Americans and 300 million patients around the world. Working in your own office, surrounded by thousands of high-caliber developers, youâ€™ll use modern development methodologies and employ user-centered design, analytics, and machine learning tools to drive innovation in healthcare. Using leading-edge technologies and languages like JS, TS, and C#, youâ€™ll invent better ways to reduce medical errors, streamline record sharing between hospitals, and provide the quality of care a patient deserves.Write software for the most innovative health systems on the planet.The top-ranked health systems in U.S. News and World Report are Epic customers. Our community includes major systems like the Mayo Clinic, Johns Hopkins, Cleveland Clinic, and Kaiser Permanente, as well as leading academic medical centers at the University of Wisconsin, University of Michigan, University of California, University of Texas, The Ohio State University, and many more.Experience our state-of-the-art campus, eat delicious food, and travel the world.We donâ€™t believe in cubicles. (Well, we believe they exist, butâ€¦) Our uniquely themed campus was designed to heighten your ability to get stuff done in your office, a conference room, or by the fireplace in a comfy chair. For lunch, visit Kingâ€™s Cross or Cassiopeia for a wide array of meal options, or go to one of our smaller, themed bistros, featuring wood-rotisserie, pan-Asian, and Latin-inspired cuisine. All meals are restaurant-quality but cost only a few dollars, and theyâ€™re prepared by a team comprised of kitchen talent from restaurants around the country. And, after five years here, youâ€™ll earn a four-week sabbatical anywhere in the world. Staff have kayaked in Patagonia, attended a BeyoncÃ© concert in Ireland, built a library in Tanzania, and run a marathon in Antarctica.Live affordably in a city known for its rising tech talent.Epic is located just outside Madison, Wisconsin, which is the second fastest growing market for tech talent in the United States, home to the state capital, and the University of Wisconsin. Madison has received accolades for being the greenest city in America (NerdWallet), the best city for renters (SmartAsset), fittest city in America (Fitbit), and, for the gamers, is one of a handful of US cities to have a Killer Queen arcade game, located at Madisonâ€™s first arcade bar.More than just important work.We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.Relocation to Madison, WI area (reimbursed)BS/BA or greater in Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related fieldA history of academic excellence or professional successEligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship (persons with appropriate qualifications and eligible for TN status under NAFTA may apply)COVID-19 vaccination

title: Compliance Analyst/UKHC
job_description: Posting DetailsJob Title Compliance Analyst/UKHCRequisition Number RE45050Working Title Compliance AnalystDepartment Name H3999:EVPHAWork Location Lexington, KYGrade Level 10Salary Range $48,360-81,328/yearType of Position StaffPosition Time Status  Full-TimeRequired EducationBAClick here for more information about equivalencies: https://hr.uky.edu/employment/working-uk/equivalenciesRequired Related Experience3 yrsRequired License/Registration/CertificationNonePhysical RequirementsThe physical requirements of this position include: occasionally lifting, pushing, and/or pulling objects weighing up to 50 lbs.; occasionally standing or walking with objects weighing up to 10 lbs.; regularly sitting at a computer workstation for extended periods of time and performing tasks with regular repetitive motions (such as typing); occasionally interacting with combative/violent people or patients; and occasional job-related travel (less than 10% of time).ShiftMonday â€“ Friday; 8:00a.m. â€“ 5:00p.m. This is a hybrid position.Job Summary| UK HealthCare ( UKHC ) is a comprehensive healthcare system consisting of medical, nursing, health sciences, public health, dental, and pharmacy patient care activities at the University of Kentucky. The Office of Corporate Compliance ( OCC ) was established in 1998 by the UKHC Executive Vice President for Health Affairs and the UK Board of Trustees to support the clinical enterprise. The OCC promotes a culture of ethics and compliance that is central to all of UKHC operations and activities; understands the nature of the risks and potential risks of UKHC operations and activities; and manages risks that may lead to financial, legal, and/or reputational loss. The OCC is currently seeking qualified applicants for a Compliance Analyst position. Reporting directly to the Compliance Audit Manager, the Compliance Analyst will assist the OCC team, led by the Chief Compliance Officer, in executing the corporate compliance program for clinical activity at UK. Those activities may include monitoring, tracking, reporting, investigations, training, and demonstrating effectiveness of the corporate compliance program. The Compliance Analyst will support enterprise policies and support mitigation of risk exposure as it works to promote a culture of compliance and ethics. The Compliance Analyst will support hospital and pharmacy compliance as a point of contact for 340B Pricing Program regulatory compliance, support compliance with regulations of controlled substances, and assist in oversight activities related to KASPER compliance and training. The position will support the OCCâ€™s role in the health care conflict of interest committee. The Compliance Analyst will perform activities supporting the compliance risk assessment and will maintain data supporting compliance program monitoring, tracking, and reporting. This is a hybrid position .Skills / Knowledge / AbilitiesThe ideal candidate for the Compliance Analyst position will understand health care operations and/or pharmacy operations. Additionally, the ideal candidate will have strong problem-solving, critical-thinking, and communication skills (both written and oral), and will be detail-oriented in order to ensure requirements are being met.Does this position have supervisory responsibilities?  NoPreferred Education/ExperienceBachelorâ€™s Degree; 3 years of experience in a health care and/or pharmacy setting; strong written and verbal communication; experience with compliance and/or privacy issues preferred.Deadline to Apply 05/07/2024University Community of InclusionThe University of Kentucky is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce by ensuring all our students, faculty, and staff work in an environment of openness and acceptance. We strive to foster a community where people of all backgrounds, identities, and perspectives can feel secure and welcome. We also value the well-being of each of our employees and are dedicated to creating a healthy place to work, learn and live. In the interest of maintaining a safe and healthy environment for our students, employees, patients and visitors the University of Kentucky is a Tobacco & Drug Free campus.As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strongly encourage veterans, individuals with disabilities, women, and all minorities to consider our employment opportunities.Any candidate offered a position may be required to pass pre-employment screenings as mandated by University of Kentucky Human Resources. These screenings may include a national background check and/or drug screen.

title: Data Scientist - Services Customer Enablement
job_description: As a Lexmark Data Scientist you will work as a part of the Services Customer Enablement team. Customer Enablement is responsible for the support web experiences and content to answer technical questions our customers or partners may have related to Lexmarkâ€™s products and their usage. Enabling customer and partners to find answers is part of self-service. Doing this when they need, on their device of preference, in their language, enables us to personalize their experience and resolve a pain point on their terms, without having to contact Lexmark.The Data Scientist will collaborate with various functional teams and stakeholders throughout Lexmark to identify opportunities to leverage company data to drive business solutions. Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of service delivery, product development, and business strategies. Provide support to the development and business area communities for Lexmark data sources, data visualization / dashboards and analysis.â€¯ Investigate how to leverage GenAI tools to provide value for content lifecycle management and or search functionality.Skillsâ€¯The skillset to be used in the job are listed below. A strong candidate will have a good foundation in some or all these areas plus the desire to learn the others.â€¯Machine Learning, Deep Learning GenAI / LLM familiarityâ€¯ Statisticsâ€¯ Programming (likely Python, R, SQL)â€¯ Data visualization (likely PBI, JMP)â€¯ Database and data structures familiarityâ€¯ Data querying skills (likely SQL)â€¯ Communication & organizational skillsâ€¯â€¯ Role Requirements:Collaboration with cross functional business areas regarding the research and testing of GenAI tools for support website experience for end users or skilled field technicians. Evaluate the use of GenAI to improve efficiency of Content Authoring team to maintain accuracy and relevance of content on support websites; including leveraging case history from Dynamics (CRM) Manage data tools and visualizations for Service Training. Enabling team to connect training effectiveness to individual performance in field. Work with cross-functional Lexmark team resources to rapidly develop proof of concepts based on business area provided data Blend methodologies from machine learning, applied statistics, and operations research in order to distill complex and disparate data sources into value-added information streams accessible by non-technical staff Create interactive applications and visualizations that empower our workforce to discover advanced analytics without becoming a data scientist Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor of Science in Physics, Math, Statistics, Economics, Chemistry, Computer Science, Data Science, or related fields or direct related experience Computing programming skills & experience such as Python, R, SQL/noSQL, Demonstrated experience with experimental design, sampling methodology, Bayesian inference, generalized linear models, hierarchical modeling, unsupervised learning (factor analysis/principal components/clustering), shrinkage methods (ridge/lasso), decision trees and deep learning. Experience with Cloud Platforms such as Azure File Storage, Azure Databricks, is a plus. General printer business domain knowledge is a plus. How to Apply ?Are you an innovator? Here is your chance to make your mark with a global technology leader. Apply now!We are proudly an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.Global Privacy Notice Lexmark is committed to appropriately protecting and managing any personal information you share with us. Click here to view Lexmark's Privacy Notice.

title: Social Service Clinician II
job_description: Advertisement Closes5/11/2024 (8:00 PM EDT)24-02666Social Service Clinician IIPay Grade 16Salary$67,204.32 AnnuallyEmployment TypeEXECUTIVE BRANCH | FULL TIME | ELIGIBLE FOR OVERTIME PAY | 18A | 37.5 HR/WKClick here for more details on state employment.Hiring AgencyCabinet for Health & Family Services | Dept for Community Based ServicesLocation455 Park PlaceSuite 120-ALexington, KY 40511 USADescriptionThe Kentucky Transportation Cabinet is committed to meeting or exceeding the needs and expectations of our customers. Our focus is on people: our customers, our employees, and our partners. We will continually improve both the delivery of our products and services and the processes that support that delivery. To provide a safe, efficient, environmentally sound, and fiscally responsible transportation system that delivers economic opportunity and enhances the quality of life in Kentucky.By joining our Division of Planning Data Management Branch as a Resource Management Analyst I in Franklin County, youâ€™ll have the opportunity to collect and maintain data in the Cabinet's Highway Information System database, as well as the Linear Referencing System or Centerline data for the Cabinet.Holders of the Resource Management Analyst I position will complete tasks such as:Learn to plan, schedule, and coordinate the collection of transportation planning data in the field or from collected software for use in Highway Performance Monitoring System (HPMS) reports and other KYTC customers.  Learn to analyze transportation planning data for quality control of the data and to fill customer requests.  Learn to provide technical assistance and training to others regarding transportation planning data for the purpose of better interpretation and practical use of the data.  Perform database and spreadsheet operations to prepare transportation planning data for customers and contractors to ensure data is more readily usable by the customers.Holders Of This Job Will Obtain The Following SkillsExperience analyzing transportation data for quality control  Experience reviewing planning highway information system documentation for technical accuracy and for compliance with established procedures and contract documents  Experience performing searches, additions, edits, and quality assurance control to large roadway datasets.Desired candidates possess the following requisite skills or experience applicable to the position:Basic Understand of Roadway Data  Experience with GIS Software  Experience with Microsoft Office  Experience working with large sets of data.Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer.The Kentucky Transportation Cabinet (KYTC) participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in U.S. KYTC will only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9.For more information on E-Verify, or if you believe that KYTC has violated its E-Verify responsibilities, please contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) at 888-897-7781 or https://www.e-verify.gov/.If you are looking for a rewarding career with a culture of employee involvement, where teamwork is the norm and measurement of performance is essential, the Kentucky Transportation Cabinet is for you! title: Senior Business Analyst
job_description: Qualifications:Bachelorâ€™s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or related field.Minimum of 8 years of experience in large IT implementation projects.Experience with business analysis, project management, and production support activities.Proven track record of successfully leading implementation planning for projects and initiatives.Strong technical and analytical skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem-solving skills.Knowledge of IT service management principles and framework (e.g., ITIL) is desirable.Project management certification (e.g., PMP) is a plus. Key Responsibilities: Lead, facilitate and contribute to the development of the implementation plan for IT modernization project, ensuring alignment with project timelines and decommissioning objectives.Collaborate closely with the Project Manager to formulate and execute the plan, working in tandem with cross-functional teams.Utilize project tools such as Azure DevOps (ADO) and MS Teams action item boards to monitor, track, manage and report progress on respective deliverables.Identify, document, and escalate risks and issues that may impact the project's go-live goals.Engage proactively with the vendor and CABINET's cross-functional teams to uphold the stability, availability, and reliability of the newly implemented Integrated Tax System (ITS).Lead and facilitate root cause analysis (RCA) sessions with the vendor to uncover underlying issues and implement corrective measures to prevent recurrence.Define, document, and oversee the incident and problem management processes, encompassing incident identification, logging, prioritization, investigation, resolution, and escalation.Actively participate in the resolution of incidents and service requests within defined timeframes.Ensure adherence to specified service level agreements (SLAs) with the implementation partner or vendor.Identify opportunities for process enhancements and efficiency improvements across implementation planning, cutover planning, and production support activities.Ensure changes are thoroughly documented, tested, and approved prior to deployment in the production environment.Coordinate change requests and enhancement initiatives to minimize disruptions to operational workflows.Collaborate with the PMO to implement best practices and standards aimed at enhancing service delivery and fostering customer satisfaction.

We support the energy, defense, and science markets through responsive, cost-effective execution of critical environmental, facilities and infrastructure, and nuclear defense and nonproliferation projects.Â Job DescriptionConduct comprehensive program/financial analysis of business systems/submission and project baselines as related to DOE project and contract management.Review contracts, programs, policies or procedures for proposals and existing contracts.Draft correspondence letters in support of Department of Energy Contracting Officer to outside.Review/analyze/coordinate reports and vouchers to determine accuracy of data, validity of assumptions, variances, allowable costs, and reasonableness of conclusions.Receive and review monthly Metrics and Earned Value Management reports from existing contractor, load into the Integrated Planning, Accountability and Budgeting System (IPABS) for DOE review and approval. title: Senior Compensation Analyst/UKHC
job_description: Posting DetailsJob Title Senior Compensation Analyst/UKHCRequisition Number RE44245Working Title Senior Compensation Analyst-ReportingDepartment Name H4009:Enterprise LearningWork Location Lexington, KYGrade Level 11Salary Range $54,080-95,056/yearType of Position StaffPosition Time Status  Full-TimeRequired EducationBAClick here for more information about equivalencies: https://hr.uky.edu/employment/working-uk/equivalenciesRequired Related Experience3 yrsRequired License/Registration/CertificationNonePhysical RequirementsThe physical requirements of this position include: occasionally standing or walking with objects up to 10lbs and regularly sitting at a computer workstation for extended periods of time with repetitive motions (such as typing).ShiftPrimarily Monday through Friday; 8:00am â€“ 5:00pm. As an exempt level position, additional hours may be required to meet department needs.Job SummaryAbout us:Who is UK Healthcare? We are a Health Care system that puts our people first: We treat you as the individual you are, thatâ€™s what makes us who we are We work in a team environment, where there is a sense of community pride within the team.  We are proud of our people who make an impact on our communityOur working environment in our Health System is unique: The UK Albert B Chandler Hospital is the #1 ranked hospital in Kentucky for the last seven years Our work is meaningful crossing every aspect of health care We offer competitive pay and rich benefits We offer highly valued professional development opportunities such as our Employee Education programJoin the team at UK HealthCare today and make a generational impact in making a healthier Kentucky!About you:You are a strategic thinker, passionate about compensation, and thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment. You love data and know how to read the story that data tells. If this is you-we encourage you to apply. Join us and be a key contributor to our mission of being one community committed to creating a healthier Kentucky.About the role:As a Senior Compensation Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing and evaluating UK HealthCareâ€™s compensation structure to ensure competitiveness and alignment with business objectives. You will assess and perform analysis on collected wage data, and prepare wage and salary data to assist compensation, forecasting, and management functions of the organization. This role requires an expert level in Excel, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.Skills / Knowledge / Responsibilities Analyze market trends to establish and maintain competitive pay ranges for the system Conduct internal salary surveys and research labor market trends Work closely with leadership and regulatory agencies, such as The Department of Labor to provide direct oversight on compensation issues related to the organizationâ€™s facilities and employees Proficient in extracting necessary data from PR, SAP , Tableau, Success Factors and IES platforms Reviews and recommends changes to compensation policies and procedures Collaborate with Recruitment staff, hiring managers, Finance and executive team, to develop and implement compensation plans for new hires, promotions, and transfers Ensure that compensation decisions are fair, equitable, and compliant with policies and relevant regulations including the compensation philosophy for the UK HealthCare.  Maintains and establishes processes to prevent pay errors, including conducting audits to maintain integrity of compensation structures and associated computer systems. Education/Background Comprehensive grasp of both hospital employee compensation and the roles/jobs within a hospital environment. Healthcare background is preferred but not required.  Demonstrated professional and operational knowledge of various functional areas of human resources in regards to Compensation both in terms of professional and operational aspects Working knowledge of all employment laws and regulations, especially governing wage and hour practices (e.g., EEO , OSHA , FMLA , FLSA ) Process management skills, including mapping and streamlining processes Organizational skills to coordinate multiple projects, goals and objectives Initiative and self-direction as well as the ability to collaborate as part of a team Must have strong oral and written communication skills to communicate with employees at all levels within a hospital/academic medical center Strong systems experience with Excel At least three years of experience as a compensation analyst is preferred Certified Compensation Professional ( CCP ) designation is preferred B.S. degree in Human Resources, Business, Finance or related field. Skills / Knowledge / AbilitiesThe successful candidate will possess and demonstrate skills, knowledge, and abilities which include the following: advanced computer skills with strong knowledge of Microsoft Office programs with emphasis in Excel worksheets; experience with database and decision support systems is preferred. Demonstrated knowledge of and experience in human resources, compensation, and data management. Ability to command respect and confidence with professional peers. Strong analytical skills. Ability to perform under changing circumstances and deadlines. Strong attention to detail with the ability to learn quickly. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Excellent customer service. Ability to gain respect and confidence with professional peers.Does this position have supervisory responsibilities?  NoPreferred Education/ExperienceMasterâ€™s degree preferred.Certified Compensation Professional Preferred.Previous compensation experience highly preferred.Deadline to Apply 05/08/2024University Community of InclusionThe University of Kentucky is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce by ensuring all our students, faculty, and staff work in an environment of openness and acceptance. We strive to foster a community where people of all backgrounds, identities, and perspectives can feel secure and welcome. We also value the well-being of each of our employees and are dedicated to creating a healthy place to work, learn and live. In the interest of maintaining a safe and healthy environment for our students, employees, patients and visitors the University of Kentucky is a Tobacco & Drug Free campus.As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strongly encourage veterans, individuals with disabilities, women, and all minorities to consider our employment opportunities.Any candidate offered a position may be required to pass pre-employment screenings as mandated by University of Kentucky Human Resources. These screenings may include a national background check and/or drug screen.

title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
job_description: Position:Senior Infrastructure EngineerJob Description:Arrow Electronics is a global provider of products, services, and solutions to industrial and commercial users of electronic components and enterprise computing solutions. Arrow Electronics guides innovation forward for over 220,000 leading technology manufacturers and service providers. With 2022 sales of $37 billion, Arrow develops technology solutions that improve business and daily life. The company maintains 228 locations worldwide with over 90 locations served.A Fortune 109 company with 22,000 employees worldwide, Arrow brings technology solutions to a breadth of markets, including telecommunications, information systems, transportation, medical, industrial, and consumer electronics. Arrow provides specialized services and expertise across the entire product lifecycle. Arrow does this by connecting customers to the right technology at the right place, time, and price. Arrow provides extraordinary value to customers and suppliers - the best technology companies in the world - and connects them through the company's industry-leading services.The Global IT infrastructure team is looking for an Infrastructure Engineer who will provide Sr Level engineering, design, and support to Servers at Arrow.What You'll Be Doing:Provide Sr level engineering, design, and support for IBM Power / AIX servers, LPARS, and workloads.Provide Sr level engineering, design, support, and security remediation for Enterprise Red Hat Linux servers and workloads.Lead the effort to plan, engineer, and design the infrastructure as well as lead the effort to evaluate, recommend, integrate, and coordinate enhancements to the infrastructure.Work with IT Architects to ensure that modified infrastructure interacts appropriately, data conversion impacts are considered, and other areas of impact are addressed and meet performance requirements of the project.Lead effort to develop and configure the infrastructure from conceptualization through stabilization using various computer platforms.Lead effort to implement the infrastructure by analyzing the current system environment and infrastructure, using technical tools and utilities, performing complex product customization, and developing implementation and verification procedures to ensure successful installation of systems hardware/software.Lead routine infrastructure analysis and evaluation of resource requirements necessary to maintain and/or expand service levels.What We Are Looking For:6+ years of related experience with a 4 year degree; or 4 years and an advanced degree; or equivalent experience.6+ years of hand on skills in AIX OS upgrade and patching, LPAR provisioning, system recovery, VIOS configuration, Network and storage virtualization, performance analysis, and capacity planning.Some knowledge of Storage Subsystems is required.Knowledge and ability to support infrastructure with automation, such as Ansible playbooks, and other scripting or automation platforms.Ability to communicate and collaborate with diverse teams and technologies, understanding technical and business requirements.Experience troubleshooting complex performance, availability, and other types of errors and outages during incidents and resolving quickly to restore services.Experience documenting technical and architectural requirements, processes, and procedures.What's In It for You:At Arrow, we recognize that financial rewards and great benefits are important aspects of an ideal job. That's why we offer competitive financial compensation, including various compensation plans, and a solid benefits package.Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance401k, With Matching ContributionsShort-Term/Long-Term Disability InsuranceHealth Savings Account (HSA)/Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) OptionsPaid Time OffTuition ReimbursementGrowth OpportunitiesAnd more!Annual Hiring Range/Hourly Rate:$99,100.00 - $140,800.00Actual compensation offer to candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level. The pay ratio between base pay and target incentive (if applicable) will be finalized at offer.Location:US-CO-Colorado (Remote Employees)Remote work employees may be required to be present at the closest designated Arrow office for work-related purposes, at the Company's request and sole discretion.Time Type:Full timeJob Category:Information TechnologyEEO Statement:Arrow is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. (Arrow EEO/AAP policy)We anticipate this requisition will be open for a minimum of five days, though it may be open for a longer period of time. We encourage your prompt application.
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, and Wholesale

title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER II
job_description: Location: Amarillo, TX, or Paducah, KY, CSI office. Job SummaryUnder moderate direction, Software Engineer IIs code, test, and debug programs. A minimum of three (3) years of successful, in-depth work experience in relevant technical fields.Required SkillsDemonstrated technical competencies, such as but not limited to: Specific technology skills vary by assigned role (e.g., .NET, C#, SQL, Angular, TypeScript etc.)Exposure to cloud platform (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP, etc.)Demonstrated understanding of APIs, function modules, etc.Communication skills â€“ written and oralCollaboration and teamwork skillsCoaching and mentorship skillsMathematical skills RELATIONSHIP BUILDING This position requires contact primarily within the department and contact within the company on routine matters. Contact outside the company is minimal. DECISION MAKING The position requires the use of judgment to plan and perform; general decisions are made to solve a problem or select a course of action for a standard or recognized method of operation. title: Test Engineer II with Security Clearance
job_description: 2024-03-08CountryDate Posted:United States of AmericaLocation:KY201: RMS Louisville 6201 Strawberry Lane Louisville, KY 40214, Louisville, KY, 40202 USAPosition Role Type:OnsiteAt Raytheon, the foundation of everything we do is rooted in our values and a higher calling - to help our nation and allies defend freedoms and deter aggression. We bring the strength of more than 100 years of experience and renowned engineering expertise to meet the needs of today's mission and stay ahead of tomorrow's threat. Our team solves tough, meaningful problems that create a safer, more secure world. Test Engineering provides technical expertise to numerous manufacturing and development programs. Our work involves electronic hardware for close in weapons system. The manufacturing operations is located in Louisville, KY Primary responsibilities include supporting test and troubleshooting of RF, IF, Analog and Digital hardware assemblies. This position requires close cooperation with the Operations team and other engineering disciplines including Product Design, Test Development and Manufacturing Engineering. The desired candidate will possess superb communication skills and be capable to work in a dynamic team environment. Extensive, on the job training, is provided. Responsibilities to Anticipate: * Interpreting test requirements, developing and maintaining test procedures, and documenting test practices * Analyzing data to drive issues to root cause * Generating Change Requests (CRs) on technical issues relating to the production test process * Developing and executing improvement projects to increase first pass yield * Engagement with Design and Test Development teams to solve issues impacting production * Ensuring hardware requirements are met and processes are followed * Assisting manufacturing operators in the testing & troubleshooting of production hardware * Supporting production test of RF/Microwave subsystems and components on functional test platforms Basic Qualifications: * Typically requires a Bachelor's in science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) and a minimum of 2 years of prior relevant experience. * 2 years of test and/or troubleshooting experience * Ability to travel 10% as required * The ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. government issued security clearance is required. Preferred Qualifications: * Masters in Electrical Engineering or Electrical Engineering Technology * Proficient use of Microsoft Office suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Word, OneNote) * RF, analog or digital test / troubleshooting skills * Labview * Test equipment knowledge/familiarity with Tektronix and Keysight instruments * Use of oscilloscopes or spectrum analyzers for testing/troubleshooting * A continuous improvement mindset to enhance manufacturing test methods through process modernization * Demonstrated success working in a fast paced manufacturing environment * Active SECRET clearance What We Offer : Whether you're just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care. Relocation assistance not available. The salary range for this role is 64,000 USD - 128,000 USD. The salary range provided is a good faith estimate representative of all experience levels. RTX considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role, function and associated responsibilities, a candidate's work experience, location, education/training, and key skills. Hired applicants may be eligible for benefits, including but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, flexible work schedules, employee assistance program, Employee Scholar Program, parental leave, paid time off, and holidays. Specific benefits are dependent upon the specific business unit as well as whether or not the position is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement. Hired applicants may be eligible for annual short-term and/or long-term incentive compensation programs depending on the level of the position and whether or not it is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement. Payments under these annual programs are not guaranteed and are dependent upon a variety of factors including, but not limited to, individual performance, business unit performance, and/or the company's performance. This role is a U.S.-based role. If the successful candidate resides in a U.S. territory, the appropriate pay structure and benefits will apply. RTX anticipates the application window closing approximately 40 days from the date the notice was posted. However, factors such as candidate flow and business necessity may require RTX to shorten or extend the application window. RTX is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
