As a Financial Analyst on the WI/HCG Data Strategy & Costing Finance Team, you will also design and implement new allocations and assignments as well as conduct essential data validation and quality review.You will be responsible for developing, rationalizing, improving, and delivering both statistical and profitability data reporting and analytical solutions for the WI / HCG finance community and our business partners. You will also partner with corporate finance to provide data and analytical support for the full suite of finance modernization initiatives. The analyses and insights delivered through our data strategy and costing work are critical components to drive business planning and ongoing decision making.The Expertise And Skills Weâ€™re Looking analysis; 1+ years of experience with advanced degreeFinancial services experience; experience in benefits outsourcing (WI/HCG) a plusProficiency in financial modeling and presentation tools (MS Excel, MS PowerPoint) with experience in business intelligence tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Business Objects, Anaplan, etc.), exposure to data ETL tools (like Alteryx and KNIME) a plusExcellent written and verbal communications skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with Finance and business partners at varying levels of the organizationIntellectual curiosityOutstanding analytical and problem-solving skills, working independently to perform most analysesStrong attention to detail and ownership for managing large quantities of detailed information with high levels of accuracyStrong interpersonal skillsAbility to take initiative and seek creative solutions that challenge conventional approachesConfidence and ability to influence others across the content.Driving high impact / high visibility data strategy projects and deliverables across WI/HCGUtilizing automated and centralized reporting solutions to provide analyses and strategic recommendations to management and business partnersSynthesizing data, analyses, and conclusions into presentation format for senior managementFinding opportunities to streamline work processes to make the team more efficient and effectiveProactive partnership and communication with business and Finance partnersUsing tools and business knowledge to continuously provide insightful information, our clients. title: Energy - Senior Client Management Analyst
job_description: We are looking for a Senior Client Management Analyst to join Insight Sourcing's Energy Practice, Insight Energy. Our Client Management Analysts provide the foundation for all aspects of ISG's internal and client-facing projects, with direction from the firm's experienced leadership. Analysts play a crucial role in building and providing data analysis that will be the basis for client decision making.WHAT YOU'LL DO (RESPONSIBILITIES):Provide support to upper-level management resources in managing each client account through ongoing updates to trackers, development of material, and the development of a professional relationship with each client.Develop, organize, and update, client trackers that demonstrates value.Communicate with client to establish forecasted volumes for those deliverables along with monthly nominations, bank balancing, requests for proposals, Market Position Reports (MPR) and Operational Flow Orders (OFO) where applicable. Manage MPR and beginning of RFP process. Research and understand each client's industry to tailor these trackers and update calls to the client's specific goals.Support Client Executives (CE) in managing relationships with assigned clients. Manage plant level relationships, attend weekly, bi-weekly calls, and prepare required information for call with guidance by CE. Function as secondary point of contact for client contacts and support the maintaining of relationships with assigned customers.Serve as additional contact within system portals (Salesforce, Capturis) to manage corporate summariesConduct ad hoc research and analysis as appropriate.  RequirementsWHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR (QUALIFICATIONS):Required:An environmental / energy, engineering or business degree, or degree in a related field, from a top undergraduate program Strong work ethic and high level of integrity Strong analytical skills and capabilities Exhibiting integrity in judgement and firm relationships Experience with Microsoft Office products, including the ability to develop and interpret complex models and ad-hoc reports Ability to effectively take on multiple projects, tasks, and initiatives simultaneously Limited travel, as needed Strong communication skills (verbal and written) Preferred:3-5 years of professional experience in the Energy Consulting industry Comfortable in an entrepreneurial, performance-driven environment and a capacity for innovation and process improvement  BenefitsABOUT US:We have established our entrepreneurial roots in Atlanta since our founding in 2002, growing to over 240 team members today. At Insight Sourcing, we blend the capability and expertise of the largest consulting firms with an entrepreneurial firm's fun, innovation, and drive. Insight Sourcing has a hybrid work model with a blend of remote and in-office expectations. We believe in the importance of collaboration, hands-on development and coaching, and fun and energizing fellowship.As a result, we enjoy whom we work with just as much as the work we do: you're a project lead to clients, you're a ping-pong champion in the break room, and you're a friendly face at office-wide lunches. You're never a number.Insight Sourcing is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO)/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, color, sex, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Please note that applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship by Insight Sourcing. Therefore, work visa sponsorship for this position will not be provided, either now or in the future.

job_description: Schneider Electric is looking for a passionate, talented, and inventive Senior Data Scientist with a passion for learning and discovery. This person will help build industry-leading machine learning tools in the energy and sustainability management industry. As a member of the Sustainability Business team, you will collaborate with internal technology and business teams to build tools to support new services, expand and improve existing services and enable our teams to be more productive. Design and develop simulation tools for training and testing ML, deep learning, and AI models.  Collaborate with other business team resources to identify, develop, test, and create new solutions/products.  Apply knowledge of technology with knowledge of contemporary business models to synthesize potential opportunities.  Work with cutting-edge technologies in ML subfields such as Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Reinforcement Learning (RL). A " can-do " attitude and the ability to work both independently and within a small group.  Experience with cloud computing (Azure is a plus!) in the context of ML and AI.  Programming expertise in languages such as Python, SQL, R, etc.  Experience with Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, Transfer Learning, etc.  3+ years experience in end-to-end Data Scince roles including deployment in web based environments.  Analytical self-starter with strong attention to detail and desire to learn new things.  Strong organizational and problem-solving skills with the ability to work on multiple complex projects in diverse areas, versatile and capable within multiple disciplines.  Understanding of microservices and orchestration-based software, i.e. Docker and Kubernetes. Bonus Skills Experience with optimization, time-series forecasting, and reinforcement learning are all a plus!  Recent experience with Large Language Models (LLMs) or other Generative AI is a plus! Familiarity with model inference, fine-tuning and retrieval augmented generation (RAG) is desired. title: Senior Application Developer
job_description: At AJ Boggs, people are our greatest asset!Accelerate your career today serving public sector clients as a Senior Application Developer. You will lead the design, development, and support of database applications for enterprise-wide system migrations. We are seeking a Senior Application Developer with a passion for continuous delivery and automation.This role may be right for you if you effectively:Have experience leading the SDLC process using SQL server integration tools in a continuous delivery environment. Communicate to address issues and ensure the smooth data migration of systems in an Agile/Scrum atmosphere. Collaborate professionally with technical teams and work with senior management to understand requirements and facilitate solutions. Conceptualize new applications, programs, and databases to meet client needs. RequirementsThe person in this role will report to the Team Lead and will perform activities consistent with the position of a Senior Application Developer which will include, but are not limited to: Analyze and design SQL solutions to ultimately automate processes.  Expand and optimize data and data pipeline architecture.  Translate business requirements into structured and maintainable designs that meet product requirements.  Lead the design, development, and support of database applications for enterprise-wide system migrations, programming ETL programs using SQL server Integration tools.  Design and specify test procedures including unit, system, and integration testing.  Design system/program test data, debug programs using appropriate system tools and ensure system/program results are accurate to meet system/program specifications.  Apply industry best practices to the software development life cycle (SDLC) employing methodologies such as Agile/Scrum and DevOps concepts.  Additional responsibilities as they relate to the position and needs of the department. Required Education, Experience, Knowledge, & Abilities Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field and a minimum of 5-7 years of progressive experience in database systems required.  4+ years of experience creating database models and management systems.  4+ years of experience with Entity Framework/ORM and data migrations/ETL processes required.  Experience with TDD and source control tools (TFS, Git, Visual Studio).  Experience leading SQL/Database initiatives and processes in a continuous delivery environment;  Familiarity using MS SQL Server and Management Studio to run SSIS packages.  Expert level of understanding of IT architectures and technical standards.  General knowledge and understanding of networks (TCP/IP, DNS, SNMP).  C# programming experience a plus.  Communicate effectively in an Agile/Scrum environment, both verbally and in writing. BenefitsBenefits & CompensationThe salary for this position depends upon your qualifications, experience, skill levels, technical competencies, and other criteria. $95,000 - 120,000. Straight-time overtime is sometimes available. Here are some of our other benefits:Group Medical, Dental, Life, HSA/FSA, and Vision Insurance SIMPLE IRA Accounts with an immediate vesting of 3% company match Paid company holidays and personal days Partial Internet and mobile phone expense reimbursement Yearly professional membership reimbursement Collaborative and innovative work environment Professional development opportunities Location & Work EnvironmentThis position is full-time and offers a hybrid work arrangement. You may be required to work in an office in Lansing, Michigan onsite approximately 1 to 4 days per month (subject to change). At A.J. Boggs, we embrace a positive work environment by demonstrating cultural awareness, flexibility, collaboration, and creativity. We are committed to equal opportunity in employment, and fostering a diverse and inclusive work culture.For more information, visit www.ajboggs.com/careers.
